Reviews.Title: “I will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Gloria S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in old town. Very close to Sea World and San Diego Zoo. Everyone was super nice and made sure your stay was the best. The room was very comfortable and liked the hotel design very much.....and yes depending on the building you stay in you may have to go through a lot of stairs but the hotel is on a hill, the stairs are expected. Overall we had a great stay and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to spend last days of vacation”
Reviews.Author: minniehappyreturns
Reviews.Content: We stay where we play and with the airport shuttle we spent our last 2 days here. We took the trolly and toured the whatney house (haunted location) and did the haunted trolley tour, our teens loved it. On the next day my husband and I stayed in while the kids explored old town. The hotel was close to our car rental so we returned that 2 days before our trip was over and saved that money by staying at the Best Western. The rooms were decorated very nice ( I get sick of the same hotel cut-out rooms) and the grounds were well kept and I found the staff friendly and accomodating. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Overall. Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CaptnSam
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Old Town by Train at 2am. The night manager was great, very helpful, informative, and even at 2am had a smile. The room was outstanding, every comfortable bed, large room, clean, pleanty of hot water. Easy walk the the trolley station and the Old Town Park. I will stay here anytime I come to San Diego and will tell everyone to stay here. You will enjoy your stay! One more thing. The buffet breakfast is in the restaurant at the top of the hill, next the the hotel, while the only have scrambled eggs on the buffet they will cook eggs to order.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but skip the free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Karen R
Reviews.Content: The room was nice - plenty of room. The rate was a lot higher in person than on the Best Western website, so be careful...but they do take AAA. There are a few flights of stairs as the property seems to go on forever. The room was quiet and the location is in the heart of Old Town - touristy area with lots of Mexican restaurants. The free breakfast voucher stated 2 eggs cooked to order, ham/bacon or sausage, homestyle potatoes, toast, coffee/juice. But what you get is buffet style with only scrambled eggs or scrambled eggs with peppers/onions and only sausage links on the day I was there. The worst part was the bread for the toast was MOLDED. We made ourselves instant oatmeal instead and got outta there.

Reviews.Title: “Geat stay and location”
Reviews.Author: oceanlover1955
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay close to Old Town. Great views and price use AAA card. Can walk to town and to shop and eat . Great staff very helpful with info.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: shannonm69
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here the end of March for MCRD Graduation. We loved the location of the Hotel but the service was awful. Upon arrival (1 hour before check in) we were not allowed to check in early. The front desk was not overly friendly at all. We had to pay over $12 a night for parking and were not allowed to park under our building the first 24 hours. When I called the front desk we were told we could park at any of the other parking structures that were over a block away from our room. My mother had a hard time walking and has to use a cane, this was very inconvenient for us. Therefore we ended up parking on the street (which is free) We parked only one night in the hotel parking lot because we couldn't find a space close enough for my mother any of the other nights we were there (4 in all) We would have had to walk 2 blocks from the other parking structures up hill to our room. After a long day on our feet this wasn't the ideal solution for my elderly mother. The fan in our bathroom was very noisy as well. My parents room when they checked in was missing it's cushions covers and we had to call housekeeping. I also thought I had left behind something in our room after we returned home. I contacted the hotel and was transferred to housekeeping, where I left a message and a number for a return call. It has been 3 days and still haven't recieved a phone call from the hotel. Thankfully I found the item I thought I had misplaced. All in all very dissappointed in the price we paid and the service we recieved from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well positioned”
Reviews.Author: britonbizz
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was comfortable and clean. The hotel is modular over a big site so reception can be a trek. Its close to the old town which is a tourist area, close to some reasonable restaraunts, mainly mexican. The trolley into town and the mall is a 10minute walk at most. The restaraunt/bar is OK but looking a bit tired probably on the list for a revamp. Things close early in this part of town for European tastes, eat early.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does not use full mattress covers”
Reviews.Author: gchase01
Reviews.Content: Nice location and pet friendly. The beds are not that comfy n the rooms are old and outdated. If you want a good location and do not care too much for comfort. This is the place for you. Service with no smile!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but be careful when calling a taxi through them”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Pak
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three days. It is a nice hotel in it's price range. The rooms are clean and decorated in western style. The staff was helpful and polite. The hotel is built on a hill and there are lots of plants everywhere. It feels like every room has its own courtyard under the sky. There are also lots of chairs and tables in those courtyards. The hotel also has a small pool and a hot tub. The main attractions around the hotel are: state historical park, heritage park, mormon battalion museum and lots of restaurants and shops. The only issue we ran into was that: on our last day we asked the hotel to call us a taxi to the airport. When we went down stairs to the lobby the driver quickly took our luggage out while I was checking out. My family also sat in the taxi. When I finally went out something did not feel right. I sat in the taxi and he started driving but did not start the meter. I asked him to do so. At this point he told me that this not a taxi and we need to pay a fixed rate in CASH. It was a difficult situation as this was 6 am and we were already on our way. I also blame myself because I got into the car, although there was no taxi sign on it. When we got to the airport I paid him what he asked for in cash. By the way this was almost double the amount I paid to taxi for getting to the hotel. We did not get the receipt either. When I got home, I called the hotel and the manager told me that they had called us a car service through a company they have agreement with. The manager I talked to was nice. he apologised and even got the receipt for me. My only concern is that the hotel should not make decisions on customer's behalf. If the customer asks for a cab, they should call a cab and not a car. Also, if there is nothing fishy then why the driver asked for cash. My initial impression was that this was an illegal taxi, but the manger insisted that it was a car service. What ever it was, I suggest guests to be careful and the hotel to remedy this situation by making it clear to the guests what is being offered. Other then that the hotel is worth staying for it charm and the old town fun.

Reviews.Title: “online reservation pet fees deceptive”
Reviews.Author: S S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, but, when you do an online reservation and are bringing a pet, the pet friendly rooms are $20 more than comparable rooms, then they charge you another $20 per night for the pet when you check out. The online site makes you think you are already paying the fee because the room is $139 when the others are $119. In actuality you will be paying $40 more per night for the pet. They should have disclosed this at the beginning. It left a bad taste in my mouth. There are alot of extra fees too. Total cost for 1 traditional 2 queen pet friendly room was $202 per night. Maintenance is slow to respond if you need assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Charming but Tourist Trap”
Reviews.Author: Sheli L
Reviews.Content: Great location, very charming hotel but be prepared to walk if you want a room with a view. Not many have a view and you need to walk steps. They charge a $7 extra resort fee that covers 2 bottles of water a day (only if you use them) plus wifi. Resturant is lousy. Staff not very welcoming. There is plenty of free overnight safe parking just up the block so you can skip the extra parking fees. Don't use the phone in the room to make "free" local calls! If you go over the free 30 minutes it will cost you (we made a 49 minute local call and it wound up costing us $4.90).

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Hacienda - Better have good knees and legs”
Reviews.Author: Swinak
Reviews.Content: We were in bldg # 5...no elevator for the last couple of sets of stairs, no big deal for us, but other folks that don't like walking up or down might want to ask for a lower floor. Wonderful location, flowers smelled great, great weather. Rooms were clean, quiet, and comfortable. If you drive...be aware you will pay for parking. Great location for Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location with Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Brad M
Reviews.Content: My partner and I selected this hotel primarily because of the location. It is within walking distance to historic Old Town. Of course, we throughly enjoyed the walk and the restaurants nearby. This hotel has tons of rooms; however only two have a view of the airport/ocean side. Unfortunately, these two rooms are the top of the hill and let me tell you...........It's a hike! The room itself was average but clean. Furniture was a bit dated. I would say somewhat early 80's. The amenities are nothing to write home about. If you care to know, the TV was not the flat screen type,which in this day and age, it is the standard in hotel rooms. Another odd thing was that we were able to hear some noise from the room above. Not enough to keep us awake at night, but enough to notice the shallow separation between floors. The parking was rather tricky because the hotel offers parking for a fee, but they neglect to let you know that there is public parking accross the street from the lobby and also on the street bordering the east side of the hotel. We opted to park on the street since we had prior knowledge of this fact. However, beaware that parking on the street and in the public lot accross the front of the hotel can be hard to find. This is because Old Town is a tourist attraction and there are many visitiors especially on weekends. This inconvenience happens during the day only. At night, you should have no trouble parking on the street. The staff at the hotel was nice and courteous. There were no issues there. Oh by the way, do try their complimentary ice water with cucumber slices. I thought it was different to garnish water with cucumbers instead of lemons. You will find it in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “February break”
Reviews.Author: 2stepRich
Reviews.Content: A Best Western Inn at first raises caution flags - the rooms are large - high ceilings - complex is large as well right in the middle of Old Town San Diego - I would stay here again - the restaurant tries, however service is not their best!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Chris_fss
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and sufficiently comfortable. The in-room safe never worked. I was moved from the 1st room I was allocated and the safe in the 2nd room never worked!!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back to this delightful hacienda every year.”
Reviews.Author: TheHarvsBoston
Reviews.Content: Great value. With a tasty breakfast included, this stay is worth the price! AAA parking discount. Near everything. Grills in the open air spaces, plenty of room to gather for groups. Super friendly and fast staff. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: BeatriceBloom
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend for a girl's weekend away. The grounds and architecture of the Hacienda is lovely. There are several places where guests can sit outside to enjoy the beautiful weather on a patio amidst bougainvilleas. From a balcony above, you can see red-tiled roofs, rich foliage, and winding staircases. It is also right in Old Town, which I think I liked the most about the place. We didn't need to get into a car if we did not feel like it, and it's kind of nice to have a few drinks and know you can just walk home. The rooms were clean and large enough but a bit dark. It is not a luxury hotel in terms of the rooms. The shutters kept the room exceptionally dark at night--great!--but did not keep out noise much. We could hear movement upstairs, voices next door, and someone emptied trash or something early in the morning. Pool and jacuzzi nice. Free breakfast not worth it. Overall, if you plan to stay in the room a lot and you are a light sleeper, I don't recommend it. If you want to be able to hang out in a fun place without having to drive and a beautiful environment, it is great.

Reviews.Title: “Warm , welcoming and greatly connected”
Reviews.Author: Borisrocks
Reviews.Content: A little jewel in the Old Town of San Diego. Receptionists were excellent and went out of their way. Maintenance was instantly available - even on a Saturday night. The hotel is located in a side street, almost without traffic, and guarantees a quiet rest at night despite Old Town's busy Saturday nightlife in San Diego Street. Old Town itself is charming with lots of good restaurants, and it boasts fantastic connections to all interstates and other thoroughfares.

Reviews.Title: “Relax, relax , relax!”
Reviews.Author: Khassady
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Best Western Hacienda Old Town San Diego for a quick two day getaway on a holiday weekend. I love this place! It is super nice, clean and beautiful. It is in the perfect spot within walking distance of many restaurants and shops. Our room was very nice and peaceful being at the end of the hallway. It also over looked old town San Diego and the airport/bay area. I also used the computer and printer in the lobby which was very accessible. They have a restaurant on the property which is nice in case you are tired and do not want to walk anywhere. Great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grounds with hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: spunkymom2
Reviews.Content: The BW Hacienda Hotel Old Town has beautiful grounds with a great location just a block from old town's main street which was a huge plus for us to walk to lunch and dinner. Easy access to the freeway on ramps as well. The hotel itself is very beautiful and the grounds are kept up very nicely. There are a lot of stairs being situated on a hill but there are elevators. We were in building 8 on the north east side to the property. The building had a wonderful view facing the ocean side but unfortunately we had a room facing away from the ocean towards the heritage park. It was very noisy at night with the traffic driving by on the street. The room itself was very spacious for a family of four and really didn't have any complaints since we were there just overnight. The staff seemed fine and no issues. The fitness center did have a few equipment that seemed to be well-kept but unfortunately we didn't have time to use. The only complaint that we did have was the hidden fees. We knew about the $12 parking fee per night but we were also charged $7 a night of general resort fee which we were told it included wi-fi, 2 bottled water in the room, some amenities in the room (coffee and tea packets) and newspaper (which we didn't get because they ran out by 9:00!). So, basically for us, we were charged $7 for the 2 bottled waters! Kind of a rip off. All in all, it was nice stay and felt is was a good deal despite the hidden fee!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sensational spot in Old Town San Diego...”
Reviews.Author: MsFickle
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to San Diego, we decided to stay in Old Town to experience some of the culture and I think we made a wise choice! The Best Western Hacienda was a beautiful hotel a few steps from the centre of old town. The service was great, especially from the bellboy who had to make several trips up an elevator with our tremendous amounts of luggage (and all with a smile!). Our room was in the back building, up on the hill with a great view off the front balcony. WIth three of us and loads of luggage, the room was spacious enough so we didn't feel cramped at all. Parking (although incurring a daily fee) was easy and convenient. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Cozy Place in the Heart of Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Rains506
Reviews.Content: You can't beat being a few steps from all the shops and restaurants in Old Town, a few steps from the light rail to take you downtown, and a few steps from endless other activities. That being said, the location is GREAT. Guest services was very helpful as well. There was a minor mix-up with the room booking and the girls at the front desk were on it immediately and solved the problem right away. Our room was clean, the staff was nice, and we had a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “A sad decline in the property and service”
Reviews.Author: NucleartravelerAz
Reviews.Content: For twelve (12) years I stayed at the Hacienda Hotel in Old Town. I saw it build up a booming tourist, business, convention and government contractor business. They had a lot of repeat guests. I was one of them. But ever so slowly, the property has entered a sliding decline. It is no longer the beautiful, garden-like place it once was. In 2011, they fired the expert groundskeeping manager and his staff and contracted the outside plants and cleaning to a contractor. This appears to have been done to cut salaries and benefits and prop up the bottom line. The hotel's appearance suffers as a result. Housekeeping staff has shrunk as well and on my last two stays I did not see even one of the housekeeping managers I had grown to know. The people who were there were pushed to the limit, sometimes not finishing with rooms until dark. The restaurant is owned by another company which is in bankruptcy with its assets being formally sold off on January 26, 2012. It too has declined. They don't even have cocktail napkins now and food quality makes me yearn for Taco Bell. The hotel attempts to prop up the restaurant financially by giving just about any guest free food. The breakfast buffet was so horrid that it wasn't even an option for free. Scrambled eggs were brown. Sausages were greasy and potatoes were wrinkled and looked days old. This hotel is facing a perfect storm of declining revenues, occupancy and a restaurant which may soon close unless it is purchased and kept open. Travel sites show rooms being sold for as low as $79 per night, so don't pay rack rate. On my last stay, I also found another area where cuts had been made: Security. My car was broken into in the garage. Another guest told me that this had happened three times to his knowledge in the past year and that it is a known problem. The hotel had no surveillance in place, just a security "guard" who was found asleep on the job just days after my vehicle was broken into. There was a time when I would see security people actively roaming the hotel all hours of the night. It occurs to me this ended about October of 2011. Senior management fought me off with a line of BS about how great their security is and how they could "track their guard with GPS", apparently unaware that GPS won't work three levels deep in a concrete and steel parking garage. The GM even said that "Those signs are the limit of our liability" and referred to it as something "beyond (their) control". Sorry. When you know you have a problem and do nothing, you are part of the problem. I sent a letter and a bill by courier to the GM who ignored it until, to their credit, the hotel's corporate office got their copy and became involved. They paid for the damages and I was comped one (1) night of my stay and I am grateful for that but not for the lies and attempted glad-handing and just utter made-up stories and admission that they covered up the damage (literally) so as not to alarm other guests. The GM even had another employee contact me to demand my first review here be taken down. I did ask TripAdvisor to do just that. It was a bit harsh. Time has given me a better perspective. The hotel is under pressure to deliver occupancy and revenue figures to the owner and they're cutting staff, services, cleaning and maintenance to prop up the bottom line as they give away rooms on the Internet. Attempting to brush off a 12-year veteran guest personally known to everyone on staff there was just offensive to me. A sad ending to 12 years as a customer but I'm moving on.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to visit San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Larry H
Reviews.Content: For my wife and me this was the most recent in a 20-year series of week-long trips from the east coast to the San Diego area to visit family and friends that we left behind in 1992; but it was the first time we have stayed at this wonderful hotel in Old Town San Diego. Clean, comfortable, charming, and centrally convenient only begins to describe our experience here. We enthusiastically endorse the descriptions and opinions in the reviews of 'lwj', 'CathyOfCal', and 'LCarolB' which appear on this website. We used the Hacienda as a base of operations, using our rental car only to reach destinations in Mira Mesa during the first two days of our stay. For the remaining days we used the super-clean and inexpensive San Diego Trolley to go to Mission Valley, El Cajon, Seaport Village & downtown/harbor locations. Lots of great shops and good restaurants within easy walking distance, even for our 65- and 75-year-old legs. Our package included free buffet breakfast on premises at the Acapulco Restaurant,and we noticed several inexpensive breakfast specials available at eateries within a block or two. We definitely plan to stay at the Hacienda on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Charming property right in Old Town”
Reviews.Author: CathyOfCal
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, and got a great rate including a hot breakfast. Large comfortable rooms, clean and nicely appointed bathrooms, free and easy to use internet access, and a SUPER accommodating staff. Everyone here went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and our travel experience perfect. The complimentary shuttle service was extremely helpful for some in our party who could not walk as far as the trolley station. The property itself rambles over a couple of acres, so be sure to get good directions for where to park to be close to your room. There are a lot of stairs on this hillside property (leading to wonderful views), so if you have difficulty with stairs or walking, be sure to mention that when you reserve your room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice old style buildings, but improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: Tom-Redmond
Reviews.Content: We came down south to San Diego from Seattle for X'mas, and decided to stay here for all the 4 nights. We bid it on Priceline and the price was competitive. The hotel was overall okay, with very nice old style of buildings, good cleaning services, friendly staff and other onsite services like free printing, computer and Internet. This hotel was in just walking distance from San Diego Old Town Historic Park, which was considered as the birthplace of California. You can find many restaurants, bars, shops, and the parking was free at the park - if you can find a spare spot. In early morning the environment was extraordinary beautiful and we enjoyed it. However, the hotel room was just okay because it wasn't a well-seen modern hotel, and I think we need dining table and chairs in there. The room was spacious and the beds were relatively comfortable, but we were unable to leave windows open because others may be able to get in without any problem - can we add some locks on the wooden blinds? Parking at hotel wasn't free - $12 per night, but we could always park it at the parking lot of state park. We didn't try out their onsite restaurant since we were able to find many other good food around. Basically and overall it was a good experience with BEST WESTERN Hacienda Hotel Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “The Hacienda Hotel in Old Town San Diego is Quaint and Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: LCarolB
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our three day stay with this Spanish style, individually owned Best Western in Old Town San Diego very much! They had free shuttle service to and from the airport and we loved the central location; walking distance to old town's shopping, restaurants, museums, and the trolley. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Our three room suite was Spanish style with a balcony off the bedroom overlooking Old Town! We particularly enjoyed the wine and cheese social offered one evening for Best Western Gold Card Members! We truly appreciate the extra mile Best Western's go to make us feel comfortable and at home! We highly recommend this quaint hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location and a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: missmkd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge, but after staying in small motels, I was glad to get to a good standard of hotel with helpful and friendly staff. The area of Old Town was beautiful and we stayed here purely by chance. The trolley is only 2 minutes away and can take you to the nearest shopping centre/cinema for just a $5 day ticket. Only complaint is the extra tax that is charged daily which added up to around $15, so after 6 nights, that was $90 that we hadn't anticipated. Nevertheless, the hot tub was a lovely indulgence after a long day walking around the zoo, and I would love to return to this hotel if I ever find myself in San Diego. Definitely recommended!! Very safe, welcoming, and the french toast is delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Sprawling but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sucheslife
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a meeting at the Convention Center. Nearly every hotle within 5 miles of Gaslight district was booked so I tried the Hacienda. It was a great stay. My room was on the top floor of the furthest building from the hotel entrance with a great view of the the San Diego bay area. The noise level in the room was minimal. The room was huge and if only it had an office chair it would have been perfect. There is parking under each building and elevators so you can avoid the steps. Still the walk from the back to the front of the property can be long. The properrty is decorated with many blooming flowers and there were many potted plants and fountains in the open common areas. The staff was great: very friendly and always helpful. And the cookies that are put out for guests in the evenings were a perfect touch. There is free wired internet in the rooms and wifi hot spots through out the common areas on the properrty. There is a free shuttle serrvice to the airport or the trolley station. The hotel is 5 minutes walking distance from the trolley station and even with contruction on the tracks in downtown you can reach the convention center within 30 to 45 minutes. A class of marines were graduating from basic training and the hotel was very popular among the parents. I wqould gladly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gottogonow
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hacienda, but it has been a couple of years since our last stay.We had a queen bedroom on the Plaza level. It had a microwave and refrigerator and free wifi. We paid $109 a night for 2 nights. Breakfast was included but it was nothing special and I would not go out of my way to have breakfast included. The property is lovely and the room was not very spacious but it was very clean and the bed was extemely comfortable. The best part was the free transportation to and from the airport and the cruise ship port. We would stay there again . We ran into a couple that could not get room issues regarding faulty plumbing and other issues resolved. I think there needs to be a little more participation by management in getting issues resolved while the customer can still be placated. The front desk staff seems to lack any authority or confidence to correct problems in a timely manner. Just an observation

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: trbaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in December while attending my sons Marine graduation. I dont have any negative things to say about this place. Its clean, great location and staff was great. The hotel took us back and forth to the Marine base. We didnt eat at the hotel, but there are lots of great restaurants within walking distance. The bus, train depot is also within walking distance if you want to go to downtown San Diego or just about anywhere around San Diego. The bus and train transportation is easy to use. We used it to go to the San Diego zoo and Balboa Park. There is plenty to do withing walking distance. I could have stayed here for a couple weeks. Great Town and great place to stay. You dont need to rent a car if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in SD”
Reviews.Author: fergwash
Reviews.Content: Very nice to visit warm, sunny San Diego. The Hacienda Old Town was a great place to stay. The price was reasonable, staff pleasant and helpful with a wine and cheese reception one evening and outstanding cookies and coffee seemingly available all the time. The king suite seemed a little cramped, especially the bathroom, but the bed was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Bart J
Reviews.Content: This is a great little unique hotel. The rooms are very spacious & quite unique. Although a small hotel they gave you little extras that you wouldnt expect. Free wifi in your room then at the front desk there are 3 computers for you to use as much as you want plus a printer to print anything you need too. Staff were friendly & helpful. Location is great too as you are located in an area called Old Town which is unique in itself. Go to the Candy Stone ice cream shop its amazing & cheap too. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very unique Best Western and I will return!”
Reviews.Author: Spatchel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise in Old Towne, San Diego. The rooms are unusual (in a good way), landscaping interesting, and very large hotel overall. The pictures will explain it much better than I. There are a couple of negative things. They charge for parking, but if you have AAA, it is free. They also provide a free breakfast for AAA members, but not at the restaurant in the hotel.... it is in a restaurant a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “No problems No Issues”
Reviews.Author: MSM19
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Hacienda is a great place to stay for a reasonable price. My room was located in the highest area of the hill in which the hotel was built on. I had a nice view of Old Town San Diego and my room was just fine. Not the Waldorf Astoria but a nice clean room with a clean comfortable bed, clean sheets, nice LCD television, coffee maker, refrigerator, microwave, and nice bathroom ammenities. The room was spotless. I did not have the opportunity to mesh with the hotel staff much but the front desk staff was friendly and took care of all my needs. I was also invited to a Christmas lighting ceramony at the hotel and I thought it was very nice. The hotel served all my needs just fine. This will work for families also

Reviews.Title: “Simply a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: GrimesWeaver
Reviews.Content: My company hosted a meeting here for the third time over the past several years and we will not be returning. While the amateur level of customer service may suffice and be overshadowed by the convenient location of this hotel, the management is ill prepared to offer anything to satisfy the more than perhaps a backpacker or fan of today's middle seat, no service, coach class airline experience. I experienced poor communication among the staff regarding meeting arrangements, coach class airline caliber catering, and awkward, rude treatment to my employees by the front desk staff. I am somehow comforted that others report in their reviews a similar perception of this hotel's hospitality, or lack thereof. The hotel itself has many environmental attributes that could offer all travelers a decent experience in San Diego, but given the many other offerings in this area, I recommend that anyone contemplating a stay here skip the notion and keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for Marine Graduation”
Reviews.Author: Uncork4
Reviews.Content: The purpose of this trip was to attend the graduation of my nephew from Marine boot camp; the facility was the MCRD, which is next to San Diego Int'l Airport. I did not want to rent a car so we finding a hotel that was in the heart of an interesting area with things to do and places to eat was important. Having a shutttle bus that go's to & from the airport was a great plus, as were their shuttles to and from the base! My husband & I chose a king suite and I arranged a queen suite for my mother and niece, their room had 2 queens and was in building 5, which I would highly recommend. Althought this building was the furthest from the lobby the view, room size, lighting and access to the pool/jacuzzi was preferred by us. The king suite, although nice, was a darker room. If having a separate doored bedroom is important then this is the best choice. This is a great hotel; although they have a bar and restaurant, it just didn't appeal to us as there were so many nicer choices within Old Town. If we have an opportunity to return to this area I would stay here again and highly recommend it for Marine base visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pauline642
Reviews.Content: We just spent eight nights at this hotel and were very happy with the whole experience. The location is great for walking around town, lots of restaurants, close to public transportation and the airport. The rooms are adequate, quiet and comfortable, the staff very friendly. The only disappointment was the breakfast which was exactly the same each morning, which got very boring, and lacked choices. We always felt completely safe (4 women) and would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: KristenP7
Reviews.Content: This is our only choice now for a San Diego Hotel. It is set up on levels on a hill overlooking Old Town. The beautiful tiered landscape with flowers and fountains, the old Spanish style architecture, and the convenience to Old Town makes it a perfect vacation spot. The staff is wonderful and often we have found specials with reasonable prices, free parking and/or breakfast. We love walking so the climb to upper level rooms is enjoyable for us. But if walking is a challenge there are lower level and handicapped access rooms and elevators to the upper levels.

Reviews.Title: “Booked for it's location to transport hub and it all worked out perfect!”
Reviews.Author: flicker999
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research we booked this hotel as we were had no transport in San Diego other than public transport and it worked out great, the transport links to downtown a d sea world work perfect and we had a full week in San Diego. The hotel itself worked out well with the fridge and coffee making facilities and free water and free Internet in the lobby. Mixed emotions on the front of staff some were super helpful others were so so, but hey a mixed bag is the best thing i can say. They did facilitate a room change easily enough and so that was positive. I think it's great hotel for families as it's reasonable price and the fridge means you guys can stock up and eat when you want. As for the breakfast well it's not worth the money, hmm I only went once and then just bought food and put it in the fridge, my husband went back every day, just not my cup of tea. The wine tasting seemed popular and coffee in the mornin was good. The laundry facilities are way back at the back of the complex and I didn't feel comfortable going there alone once it got dark but it all worked fine another good thing if you were bring a family here. Internet facilities were good and it did not take me too long to find promotion codes for discount in sea world and if it doesn't work online call them with the code and they will help you and email you on the ticket, saved nearly 50 dollars so worth the bit of research think. Rooms were clean , old fashion decor , and old fashion bathroom suite but wouldn't put me off coming back!

Reviews.Title: “bad vibes”
Reviews.Author: bigles68
Reviews.Content: I was leading a party of 20 clients. We were not welcomed too warmly. Some rooms unacceptable. Either dirty or next to motorway side. We were put outside on an unheated patio for our first breakfast. We were told that the indoor dining room was 'FOR GUESTS'. After much discussion this was changed for the next day. The management was young and inexperienced, and I felt that they wan ted to help but did not know how exactly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PenguinLuver23
Reviews.Content: First stayed here 20 years ago and not much has changed, except you now pay $6 a night for parking. Got a "city view" room in Bldg 6 on the 2nd floor. The rooms could use an update, although we did have a flat screen TV on the wall. Refrigerator, microwave and coffee machine were handy. Clean room. Didn't use the pool. The grounds are nicely kept, gorgeous flowers. Nice to park the car and walk to Old Town for dinner. Strange breakfast arrangement. Was included in the rate at the Alcapulco Restaurant. But you could only have coffee or OJ, don't ask for grapefruit as you'll get turned down, bacon, sausage, ham, eggs and toast. Restaurant not the cleanest. Would not eat dinner here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: OakParkTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in May of 2010, and are going back this weekend for a long weekend. We loved our stay last year, so I did not look any further when I needed to book a San Diego hotel again. The room was large and beautiful. The hotel grounds and location are beautiful as well. Price is great for what you get. I highly recommend this choice in Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: zippydodah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a family reunion. Great rooms, great views. We had use of a grill and a large room for the get-to-gathers. Restaurant on premises and only a short walk to all the other restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Love Old Town Hacienda”
Reviews.Author: Tubes11
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times and absolutely love it. We have never had a problem with the staff, they are wonderful. We have recommended this hotel to all our friends. Old Town is a very interesting historical area. We enjoy the park area and all the local restaurants & stores. Very clean and friendly area, we have never felt nervous at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Russell H
Reviews.Content: The best western hacienda is in the perfect location for almost everything. Short drive to down town/ gas lamp district, or a short stroll to historic old town. The location is amazing! Historic old town have everything from shopping, restaurants, candy stores, cigar shops and more! I was very pleased with the service at the hotel. The rooms were clean and modern looking. The experience was amazing, definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to experience san diego!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, useful if no car”
Reviews.Author: uktraveller1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights, overall for what we paid we had no complaints at all. Plus points: easy walking distance to Old Town. If you have no car, then you can walk to the Blue/green MTS trolley and to the buses into SeaWorld, beaches etc quite easily. The rooms were spacious, a small couch and space to sit outside. We found it to be quite quiet, I think as the hotel is quite spreadout and rabbit warren like, we didn't get much foot traffic outside. We couldn't get wifi in our room but ok in reception, where there were also PCs. We had breakfast included, which is down the street at OHungrys... for us, uk visitors, we just couldn't each such a big breakfast every morning though! Just cereal or fruit would have suited us. We didn't use the restaurant at the hotel at all. We didn't really ask much of the staff, but what service we had was helpful and polite. Old Town is good for eating, but it's not far to get into Gaslamp on the trolley for other options.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place in old town san diego”
Reviews.Author: michel_josee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hacienda with my 2 teenagers and husband last summer - it was a great location central to old town . I really appreciated the pool and everynigth fireworks from seaworld that could be seen from the terrace...all rooms are quite large and cosy with a definite south of the border look - very pretty. service was great. next to old town restaurants with a lot of activities around

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful In the ♥ of Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Auntie-Nanuuq
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay @ this particular hotel. I really enjoy myself when I'm there. It's beautiful and built on leveled terraces.... The rooms for the disabled have walk-in shower stalls..... It's a block from Historic Old Town and Heritage Square as well.... In fact you can walk and sight see Old Town, it's that close! The Downtown trolley is but a few blocks....you can park & ride if you prefer and you're only a few minutes away from the harbor (whale watching & harbor cruises) and Sea World. They give you free breakfast at a small cafe in Old Town...but the staff there is Snarky & rude....but that another review for another time.... The 1 thing I absolutely HATE about this hotel is the $5 per night "Resort Fee".... for a bottle of generic water, morning coffee (if you decide to make it), and local newspapers in the Lobby. Really who cares, I Always bring my own....not to mention since when did such a ridiculous charge become a standard fee? I'd rather go without...but they refuse to give you that option. If they are so in need of the extra $$ for a 25 cent cup of coffee & 75 cent bottle of water then....I'd rather have them raise the room prices $5 than pay bogus "Resort Fees".... Or better yet, why not give me the option water? Coffee?

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for families or a get-a-way in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: James P
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from...and I hate to reveal it...the best kept secret in San Diego...The Hacienda / Best Western Old Town. We discovered this hotel about 10 years ago when we went to see our son graduate from Marine boot camp. I live in Oxnard Ca.but travel frequently to San Diego on business and vacation. We had stayed at several different San Diego area hotels, [Marriott, Embassy Suites, etc] before finding the Hacienda... but now, anytime I am in San Diego this is the only hotel we go to. The rooms are clean and well kept, as are the surrounding hotel grounds. It is a very large complex but you would never know it because it has the feel a small family owned hotel. There are many little areas on the grounds with tables and chairs...and fountains... where you can just sit, relax, and read a book, or just enjoy the weather and the peace and quiet. There is also a nice pool area and an Acapulco restaurant located right on the hotel property. Many of the higher up rooms all have beautiful views of the San Diego downtown and water. The staff are always friendly and helpful and go above and beyond the call of duty to make your stay enjoyable. Oh..did I mention it is the BEST value for the money spent for a room? My recent stay was to see a Charger football game over the Labor day weekend, and the room cost a tad bit more...but most times we stay for around $100, because they offer AAA, as well as other deals. It is in walking distance of all the restaurants and shops of old town, and a short drive to all the major attractions of the city. If you want a place where there is peace and quiet...but also close to the action...Hacienda is the place. We love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Old Town”
Reviews.Author: MRO_13
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Hacienda Hotel in Old Town San Diego is a sprawling complex located on top of a hill overlooking Old Town, the city, with views of the bay, and Sea World in the distance. I love staying here because of it's location. There are countless restaurants and shops easily within walking distance. The area also has various historic buildings nearby. The rooms are fairly large and comfortable. The staff is friendly and efficient. My one criticism is the parking situation at the hotel. The parking structure has spaces that are too narrow. Cars are packed in the structure like sardines! It was REALLY hard to park because of the narrow spaces. Also, many times the structure was full. I think the hotel might sell parking spaces for the day to people who are not hotel guests. Parking in the area of Old Town is a challenge. Despite the parking problem, I will stay at the Best Western Hacienda the next time I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Kerzy
Reviews.Content: Second time we have stayed here and we love it. Convenient for restaurants, bars and trolley which takes you all over San Diego. Room a bit out of the way (up 6 flits of stairs) but fitter when we left! Pool area lovely and access to old town spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: WantToSeeItAll
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to pay $12 a day for parking, %5. a day for 2 small bottles of water, and climb A LOT of stairs every day getting back and forth. Other than that, I loved the place. Within walking distance of Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Densonfrnc
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms updated and clean. Nice pool area. The property is spread out over a large area do be prepared for a little walk. A bit confusing they way it's set up. Pool very nice. Room service very limited for kids easy walking to old town

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: drewantha
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to all Old Town sights & food. Be prepared for lots of stairs if you don't want to use the elevator. Breakfast is less than usual Best Western fare. It was clean & friendly and rooms were OK.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: DM85
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night with a friend as a stop over. We found the hotel to be lovely. The gardens were really pretty and the rooms were large and very nicely decorated. We got to the hotel a bit early when we checked in, but they stored our bags for us. The location of the hotel was very good as well. At the bottom of the street were bars and restaurants. The first bar at the bottom of the street did nice drinks (alcoholic slushie type drinks were our faves). If you went through the car park opposite the hotel it led straight to the Old Town Historic Park which was nice and also had some great places to drink/ eat. The train station was only 5/10 mins walk away too which was handy as we were travelling by train (the train from San Diego to LA was a really beautiful trip). All in all we had a great stay at this hotel. The area was really nice and we only wished we had longer to sample San Diego and the food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we went by other reviewers and not my daughters advice”
Reviews.Author: JoeHanley18
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived on 3rd June for a four night stay in "Old Town" San Diego. After a disappointing hotel stay at Planet Hollywood in Las Vegas, we were firstly very impressed with the locetion, cleanliness, and lovely friendly staff at the Best Western Hacienda Hotel. We had a beautifull, immaculate, spacious room overlooking very well tended gardens. There is a beautiful pool area if all you want to do is chill out after a hectic day doing what tourists do. The location is excellent for access to all of San Diego, you don't even need to take your car into the tourist attractions such as Gaslight District (for eating and shopping and sightseeing), or Seaport Village as there is a trolley service almost on your doorstep to their doorstep. The restaurants and shops in Old Town are all first class, We would recommend this hotel and destination for a fantastic vacation. Before we left Scotland my daughter told us Best Western hotels tended to be at the lower end of the scale, well, I can assure you this is not the case with this hotel. I t is excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect San Diego hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABH57
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in Old Town San Diego, just minutes from San Diego attractions. Hotel is on a hill top and has multiple floors, and most rooms have a view as well as a balcony. Good location and very nice hotel for the cost of the room compared to most other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Old Town, fabulous room, "Just OK" customer service”
Reviews.Author: Image7801
Reviews.Content: We discovered this hotel a few trips back, but never stayed there. So, this time out to San Diego we decided to give it a try. I wasn't sure about staying "inland", as we go out there to be near the ocean, but this place convinced us otherwise. First of all, it's a huge place. There are many separate buildings spread across the hillside above Old Town San Diego. We happened to get a nice room on the 2nd Floor of one building, which looked out over Old Town towards distant Point Loma. We were very pleased. The room was large, with two Queen beds, a refrigerator and small microwave. It was quiet, clean and well-kept. As I said, the location is great and there is so much going on in Old Town, we just spent a whole day bumming around, having some margaritas, etc... As I walked across the "campus" towards the swimming pool, I realized that there are rooms that don't look out onto anything (they actually face the hillside), but you would just have to be conscious of that (I'm sure some people wouldn't care anyway). The grounds were well kept, the buildings were clean and we had a great stay...except for really mediocre customer service from the front desk. That was really the only thing that I wasn't too pleased with. It's not that the front desk staff (several of them) were RUDE, per se, they just weren't too focused on customer service. I call these types of people "overly efficient"; they do their job but don't put any "love" into it, if you know what I mean. They make you feel like you're burdening them by asking for anything. I went down for some extra towels, and the clerk gave an obvious *sigh*, reluctantly opened the cabinet behind her to reveal a pile of towels, none of which were in any sort of order, and no bath towels. So, I had to trudge back up 3 flights of stairs to wait on a maid to deliver them - Which she did, promptly, I might add. No concerns with housekeeping, they did a great job. It just seems that the front desk staff is the major customer service problem, nobody else that I ran across acted like that. The last thing I might mention is that it's not cheap to stay there. For a Best Western, it's pretty pricey, so if you have AAA, AARP or another discount method, use it. The parking is $12 per day (!), but it's in Old Town and parking is at a premium, especially weekends. You can try for the free Old Town parking lot across the street, but it was packed the whole time we were there (Sat-Mon), including into the evenings. Overall, a great stay. If they can improve their customer service at the front desk, it's a winner in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Decor and in a great location of Old Town, San Diego”
Reviews.Author: lisee43
Reviews.Content: We've been to Old Town, San Diego a few times and we had stayed at the Holiday Inn before. Well on our last visit we decided to try a different hotel and came upon the Best Western Hacienda Hotel. We wanted to stay because of the location and we were so pleasantly surprised on how nice it was. There is a nice courtyard outside the rooms and stairs that lead down into Old Town. All the restaurants etc. were close by and so much nicer not having to find a parking spot. The location was perfect and the room was very nice and clean and the hotel grounds were so relaxing. We will definately be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way, but good”
Reviews.Author: maryb35
Reviews.Content: We hand't intended staying in Dan Diego's Old Town, but it had the only accommodation available at our price. We had no complaints. Our room, though large, was a little dark, but maybe that's a good thing in summer. We didn't eat here, except for breakfast, which was OK. It has a lift, which was appreciated since there are many flights of stairs to get around. We were charged for parking, which I thought was a bit unusual in an out of town motel. Otherwise, no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dokel
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 stayed at this Best Western. The room we stayed in was completely renovated. It was very clean and comfortable. The hotel is located within walking distance of Old San Diego, which has excellent restaurants and pubs. As well, it is only a 5-10 minute drive to Sea World and the Airport. Will definitely stay here again if we return to San Diego. The front desk service was also excellent. They were very helpful and informative.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelfan223
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at this hotel back in May. The views where amazing! The room was comfortable and we simply loved the location. Old Town is literally outside your door! The staff was very friendly. This is the best place to stay in Old Town, its truly has character!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful but with a few problems”
Reviews.Author: rachelia18
Reviews.Content: thought it was a gorgeous hotel and loved the way the rooms looked, ie. decor, comfort of bed, bathrooms, television, etc. In that it exceeded my expectations. I also really loved the pick up service at the airport. That was so helpful. I was at the hotel for a wedding and had two seperate reservations for two days each with a night in between where I stayed elsewhere. But a few problems to note, 1. Our room was not ready in time for check in. It took a few hours to find us a room. However when we did get the room it was beautiful so there is that. 2. We had to cancel one night of our second reservation. I understand that you have a 48 hour policy but it was not posted anywhere. I notified the hotel within 24 hours and they rebooked the room with another guest but still I was charged the full amount of the stay. I felt that this was slightly unethical since the hotel recouped the money twice. 3. While most of the staff that I dealt with was very friendly even when I was voicing a complaint about the above two issues. When I did check in the second time at night (around 12:30 am) there was a staff member who had a bit of an attitude which was a bit surprising because I was not voicing a complaint, just checking in. She might have just been having a bad day because she was also short with the gentleman who was ahead of us in line. But then when it was our turn next she barked at us asking whether we were guests at the hotel. Then she seemed a bit nicer when we told her we were checking in but then when we asked for a wake up call and cab in the morning this was just too much for her and she was aggrevated again. 4. my bill was incorrect the first time i checked out but it was fixed immediately as soon as I pointed it out. 5. while the breakfast far exceeded my expectations in that it was really delicious, the best hotel breakfast I've ever had. But the service was awful. We must have waited 20 minutes for a waiter to take our order and then almost 40 minutes for it to show up. I had to go to the kitchen myself to get a drink. 6. wifi did not work at all in the hotel room or lobby but the computers in the lobby were great and loved the printer for my boarding pass. 7. I did not appreciate the $5 a day resort fee which was basically for two bottles of water that were not replenished every day. So I paid $10 for two bottles of water the first stay and $10 a day for two bottles of water the second stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrifc Place to Stay in Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Terrapin621
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed every minute of our vacation in San Diego. The hotel is barely a block from Old Town and across the street from Heritage Park. Check-in was a breeze and because the property is so large, a map was provided. We found our room without problem. The lobby is inviting with plenty of places to sit, indoors or out. You can park in the garage ($12 a night) or on the street, or in a public parking lot across the street. The parking garage is narrow and difficult to maneuver if you have a large vehicle so you might want to walk the garage before you commit to paying for parking. Our room (top floor of the 500 bldg.) was neat and clean when we arrived and housekeeping kept it that way the entire time we were there. The room had comfortable beds, lots of top of the line sheets and comforters, and big bath towels. It had a coffee pot, mini-fridge and microwave, too. There’s a courtyard in the middle of the complex with lots of tables and chairs so you can sit outside and relax. The landscaping is well kept and, in keeping with the stucco walls and red tile roof, there were murals on several of the walls. It’s a pristine, elegant, and very comfortable place to stay. The only down-side is that no breakfast is served at the hotel. We got vouchers for breakfast at O’Hungry’s in Old Town but it was such a greasy spoon kind of place that I wouldn’t go back!! Old Town San Diego has a collection of Mexican restaurants. We tried Café Coyote, Old Town Mexican Café and Miguel’s. Miguel’s serves the freshest, most authentic food. The wait staff is very attentive, and the prices are very reasonable. I think Miguel’s is the best on the block and it’s just down the steps from the center of the hotel courtyard. Breakfast can be difficult to find in Old Town if you’re not into huevos rancheros or greasy spoon establishments. We discovered a tiny little place on San Diego Ave (Old Town’s main street) called Old Town Gourmet Café. It has amazing coffee (I’m from Seattle and I need my espresso!) and serves freshly baked croissants, lox and bagels, and pastries of all kinds. It also serves soups and sandwiches at lunch time and fresh fruit smoothies any time of the day. This gem of a café is across the street from Miguel’s, on San Diego Ave between Arista St. and Linwood St. We used public transportation to tour San Diego. The transit station is about two blocks from the hotel. If you buy an all-day pass for the tram, you can use it on the bus, as well. We used the tram to get to Embarcadero, Sea Port Village, Horton Plaza and other downtown attractions. You can take a ferry or a bus to Coronado Island (eat at Lil Piggy’s – their pulled pork sandwiches are awesome!) The shops at the ferry dock are fun to explore and you can sunbathe on the beach near the ferry dock and swim to your heart’s content. We also took the bus to Balboa Park (allow 4 or more hours to do Balboa Park justice). A free tram within Balboa Park will take you to the zoo (allow 4-6 hours to enjoy the zoo). The Hacienda Hotel is the perfect location if you want to tour Old Town and then hop on a tram or bus to visit nearby attractions. We’ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “good stay, great location!!!! free parking across the street”
Reviews.Author: alvakare
Reviews.Content: I did not want to get discourage by all the comments from previous guests, so I asked for a room free of pet odor, and a view! I stayed in the 800 building, which is just next to the lobby. It was nice, cool breeze came through the window and everything was nice and clean! We did not like the sofa bed. (which we did not use) It was a very odd looking bed. It needs to be replaced!! The front desk was helpful, and we were able to print our prepaid tickets to the zoo from their computers with no issues and for free. Do not pay for $12 parking, you can always park across the street which is public parking for Old Town. The location is perfect! Walking distance from lots of Mexican restaurants so no worries about drinking and driving!

Reviews.Title: “Huge DIsappointment -- Tiny Outdated Suite”
Reviews.Author: jeffepops
Reviews.Content: Their "Suites" are tiny outdated room with a cheap twin-size sofa bed that was horribly uncomfortable. We used a roll away instead. All suites (They only have suites in one building) overlook the alley and dumpsters. Ours was in the worst spot of all, Asked to have room switched to 2nd floor; desk clerk claimed none available, but several were definitely unoccupied. Check-in staff really don't care, and there was no manager on duty when we checked in just before 6 p.m. The lobby and grounds are pretty attractive, but when your king bed has only one tiny nightstand and the kitchenette features a dirty old toaster and a few mismatched dishes, you know you've been had. We travel quite a bit, and this hotel does not measure up to any of the other major hotel chains' suites. Definitely our last stay with Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasent experience”
Reviews.Author: iwannaseetheworld07
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 1 night in one of the king bedroom suite at BestWestern Hacienda. The room had a strange odor and felt very stuffy. I enjoy sleeping on hard bed, but the bed was even hard for me. Also, both me and my wife woke up with a bad headache the next morning - not sure if it is related to the stuffiness.

Reviews.Title: “Great location helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: melpd
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay. Loved the free breakfast wonderful location. Asked the staff for directions for whale watching and ended up taking me and picking me up. It made my trip so worry free.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: forgotmypword
Reviews.Content: My kids noticed this place when we were in Old Town on a day trip 4 years ago and when we talked about going back and staying over, my son, who was 10 at the time of our last visit, remembered this place and asked to stay here! We checked it out, liked the reviews and rate so we booked. I must say the hotel is a bit confusing at first ... 7 (or 8?) buildings all built into a hill and linked with different stair cases and elevators ... but once you get the hang of it, you're golden. The room was quite pleasant with two queen beds, and a love seat sized sleep sofa. Very clean and comfy. The bathroom was nice and having the extra sink outside of the bathroom was a plus ... since we're a family of 4. The SHOWER ... wow! Great water pressure, great shower head, and lovely bath and hair products. My daughter has already scoped out where to buy them on-line. Love the fresh orange scent. The hotel had tables and chairs scattered about in the various court yards and in other common areas. They even had a grill available for your use so you could cook outdoors if you are so inclined. Although as I said to my daughter when she asked for room service --- NO WAY! There's too many restaurants to choose from -- lol! There's several wifi "hotspots" in common areas and in our room, I used the free wired connection which worked great. All in all, a nice place with good value for the price. It's not a 4* hotel, nobody is waiting to open your car door and unload your baggage, but the staff was pleasant, the rooms clean and spacious, and the common areas calm and inviting. I only wish we had spent more than one night!! Ah well ... maybe NEXT time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, nasty staff a concern”
Reviews.Author: Wizzywoo90210
Reviews.Content: The hotel and location are fabulous but the deal you pay for can be a different story. We purchased a room with a bay view for 4 nights that included breakfast for 2 people, this meant we would eat at the hotel restaurant 'Acapulco's' and pay for the children. As soon as we checked in we were told we had breakfast vouchers to dine offsite at a greasy place down the road at O'Hungry's diner which included two eggs and a pancake for the total value of $2.99 as advertised on O'Hungry's shop window. After a call to Jenny at the reception ( who was not concerned with the fact that we wanted to eat at the hotel restaurant and pay for our children to eat fruit and cereal for breakfast), the manager organized for us to eat at Acapulco's restaurant. We were then faced with America (female waitress) unprepared to order a $6.99 fruit platter for our girls even though we were very happy to pay for the food, she insisted the fruit was not included in the meal voucher (obviously). Once the restaurant manager stepped in we were able to order and pay for the food required to feed two little girls with no further fuss. In addition we discovered today 21st April that our credit card was charged twice this morning for approx $1300.00 AUD after we checked out yesterday for double the total of the invoice even though this hotel had been paid days in advance with authentic American Express travelers cheques and cash, luckily our bank in Australia had seen the hotel's inadequacies and immediately reversed the fraudulent credit card transactions. To top this off, the room booked did not have a view as previously confirmed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Dutch64_11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel site is built on a hill above Old Town. When you book make sure that you include Overnight Parking. Easy 1 block walk to the State Park, Shopping and Dinning. There is a major transportation hub about 4blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: SunAndSand4me
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel in a great location in the heart of quaint Old Town. The hotel was very charming and so was the staff. The ambiance was such that we felt like we were in Mexico - beautiful tiles, bougainvillea, fountains, courtyards and pool area. The staff was very helpful, courteous and professional and took care of our every need immediately. Our room was very lovely and clean. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. Every morning we awoke to the sound of birds chirping and, after opening our wooden shutters, a panoramic view of Old Town and beyond. Parking, a hot breakfast at a nearby restaurant in Old town, two bottles of water (daily), coffee and tea were included in our rate, which we felt was very reasonable. Also included were wonderful orange-scented, natural Tarocco bath and body products (I travel constantly for work and I rarely see such quality products in the rooms in which I stay). Also, free newspapers and coffee were provided by the fireplace in the cozy lobby each morning. We love this hotel, its staff and its location. We will definitely return sooner than later. We recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected...”
Reviews.Author: kcollett67
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was wary of this hotel. The reason I stayed there was the excellent rate on hotels.com, coupled with a website discount, put the price total $74.00/night (including parking and resort fee). Laura, in reception, was pleasant and helpful. Parking seemed to be a standard parking garage in San Diego - small and tight. The grounds are very nice, with lots of plants, seating areas and beautiful tiles throughout. There is a kind of maze effect the place has as the buildings are all about and on many different levels. Our room was above the pool. Pool area is nice and clean with an expansive view. The hotel is old, but the building we were in was updated - not sure on the others. Room 506 had nice linens, good pillows and a firm mattress. TV is flat screen w/ HBO. Coffee and water provided (part of the resort fee). Bathroom had a tub and shower. Everything was very clean. There was a little sitting area separated from the bed, which provided some privacy to the bed area. I could hear creaking above us and there was some late night noise, but nothing a glass of wine could not remedy. Restaurants, shops and bars are a very short walk away. All in all , it's a good value and I would recommend the hotel (even at a higher price) and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: joy2day
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. We arrived early (10:30 am) and stopped in. Our room was not available (as we expected), so we parked the car, got some lunch suggestions and set off to walk around Old Town. The location is great with easy access to I-5 and I-8. The room was spacious and comfortable. Yes, the decor is dated, but it is not run-down. Towels were thick towels, the bed was comfortable, the refrigerator and microwave worked well, ... Our room had the TV off to the side of the bed, and it was not easily viewed from the couch due to a partition between the sitting area and the bed, but this was not a big deal for us. Our room rate included breakfast. We received daily coupons for the breakfast special a local restaurant. This worked out well, although the restaurant was crowded on weekend mornings, esp. after 8:30 or so. The hotel complex is pleasant (unless it is raining). It is a little overwhelming to find your way around. The lobby and the garage area are served by different elevators that take you to the Plaza level. From the plaza area, you can walk through the complex to an elevator for higher floors. All in all, this was a nice stay in a clean, comfortable hotel with character.

Reviews.Title: “A good Hotel - Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: bax52
Reviews.Content: Stayed in San Diego for a congress and really struggled to get a hotel. This was one of very few options left and arrived fearing the worst. Actually really enjoyed the stay. The hotel is very clean, and the linens and bed very comfortable. Rooms were big and spacious too. Only downsides where 70's style brown bathrooms. Looked dated even though they were spotless. Also room noise from adjoining rooms was quite bad. The hotel doesnt have a bar downstairs which was a shame. I think there is one in the Acapulco restaurant, but we couldnt be bothered wondering the complex looking for it. As we were on business it was also quite hard to get a taxi at 8.30 as the Old Town seems to be a tourist / evening area. Overall, though a decent hotel, with nice staff. Id stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Here - Just as I Remembered!”
Reviews.Author: cleanhand13
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several years ago when visiting family. It hasn't changed a bit and that's a good thing! It's a great location in Old Town - you can look over the entire area from your room (depending on which side you face, of course). The rooms are relatively clean - as clean as any moderately priced hotel I've ever been to in the past. I am a germ nut, so I always carry sanitizing wipes and I clean the phone and remote as soon as I get in the room. I also pack slippers because I never walk on the carpet in bare feet. That being said, the room was never truly cleaned while we were there. It didn't get dirtier, it just stayed the same - it was fine. The staff was friendly to us. I read other reviews and there seemed to be problems for some guests. We didn't experience this. I always have a smile on my face when talking to someone who is helping me...don't know if that is the difference or not. Plus, we checked in around 11pm on Christmas Day. If anyone was going to be a grump, it should have been the staff who helped us, but they were friendly, smiling and helpful. We didn't have to pay $5 a day service fee. We did book through Travelocity, so maybe we paid it in advance - who knows. Parking was $12 a day. The structure was easy to navigate and worth the money. Every morning I did hear the garbage trucks. It's a trade-off I suppose. I had great views, but I also had the noise of the street (it's just the trucks echoing up the hillside). I would hear it and fall right back to sleep because the beds are very comfortable. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel and the food was good. We both had drinks and those were also good. Overall, I can't complain. I visit SD every few years to see family and friends. I will return again!

Reviews.Title: “A true love hate relationship with this property!”
Reviews.Author: Tailhuntress
Reviews.Content: Just had probably my 14th visit this last week. It is one of the nicest properties around and sits beautifully on a hill over looking Old Town and the bay. On a clear day you can see out to the Coronado Islands. The trade off is the staff. For business and pleasure we travel and stay in hotels over 100 nights a year. About three years ago the service here really took a dive. From us hosting an event over a weekend with about 75 room nights, to just staying ourselves for one night and everything in between... the general attitude from the front desk on up is that they are doing you a huge favor by just existing. We now limit our stay to one night a year as the place itself has huge sentimental value to our family and the location if you are visiting Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “MAKE SURE YOUR RATE AT CHECK OUT IS THE SAME AS CHECK IN!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheFreindlyBiker
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very beautiful and yes the restaurant staff was great, but I agree the front desk staff needs a lot of work. I was given a price (as a walk up) of $110.00 for a room with 2 queen beds plus $12.00 for parking ( Why? Where are you going to put your car if not in the hotel garage?) + $5.00 Resort fee + $2.50 for some other stupid fee and at time of check it jumped up to $131.00 + all the other fees. They said the night auditor found a mistake and corrected with never saying a word to me about. YOU SIGN FOR AN AGREED RATE AT TIME OF CHECK IN, YOU SHOULD PAY THE SAME RATE AT CHECK OUT!!!!! The staff and GM are very rude. The GM Laughed that I was complaining over $20.00 a night difference. They can blow their hotel out of their fanny for all I care. I will stay in a fleabag hotel before I will stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Excellent staff!!”
Reviews.Author: msneel
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is quite large, so it can be kindof confusing trying to locate your room. But other than that, the staff and the location are really really great! They provide free shuttle to and from the airport. The hotel is smack dab in the heart of Old Town. There's so much to walk to, you don't need a car. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Coakster1966
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel and the rooms were not so clean, but it was affordable and in a great location. WIthin walking distance of Old Town and a short drive to downtown. I had originally reserved a queen standard, but the front desk clerk talked me into a jacuzzi suite. The jacuzzi was nice, but the floors were dirty and there were items in the cupboards left over from previous travelers. However, the staff was very friendly and free breakfast was very good. They had yogurt, make your own waffles, fresh fruit, cereal and muffins and pastries. There was also a very clean laundry room.

Reviews.Title: “Leaving stuff in the room will get stolen”
Reviews.Author: baseman123
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel for a military reuion, the gifts I bought for my girlfriend were gone. Complained to hotel manager but was not taken seriously. Be very careful of what you leave in your room.Opt for no maid service unless you are in the room.

Reviews.Title: “don~t forget anything in your room”
Reviews.Author: vidal51
Reviews.Content: Room was small . I could hear people talking at 3:00 am could not sleep . I FORGOT MY 200 DOLLAR SUN GLASSES IN THE ROOM , We are 100% positive they were in the room . when i called at 9:15 am they went to my room and they said there is no glasses THEY KEPT MY GLASSES .... To them its no big deal......

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful hotel in Old Town San Diego”
Reviews.Author: weary_traveller25
Reviews.Content: My company booked me at the Best Western Hacienda Hotel in Old Town on a recent business trip and I left very satisfied. I travel a lot for work, and often I stay at Best Western properties. They vary in quality from excellent to awful. This hotel is much closer to excellent. I can't say enough about the location. You walk down the hill from the hotel and you are in the heart of Old Town San Diego, which has tons of restaurants, shopping, bars, and tourist friendly establishments. If you are visiting other parts of San Diego, you'll need a car which you can park in their garage for $12 per day. If you are just staying in Old Town, you won't need a car because everything is within walking distance. Several reviewers have commented about being forced to find parking on the street but this was not the case for me. My company specifically requested that parking and breakfast be included in my charges and there were ample parking spots in the hotel garage. I had never stayed in an establishment quite like this one. It was clearly designed for tourists in mind (consider where it was located). As a business traveller, there are a few things I look for in a hotel--internet service, breakfast, iron & ironing board, etc. The hotel had wife-hotspots in the courtyard, but it seems that almost every room faced the courtyard so I always got a pretty good signal. Breakfast was served at O'Hungry's around the corner. While it would've been nice to have breakfast served in the hotel itself, I'm sure if someone were on vacation this would not be a major imposition. The room was nice and comfortable. The bed was soft and I slept well every night. The only two issues I had were the loud and unruly people staying at the hotel and the tiny little bathroom shower and sink. First of all, I understand that it is primarily a tourist hotel. However, even at a tourist hotel they should be required to keep the noise level to a minimum after midnight. At least two nights while I was there, I had trouble sleeping due to the loud conversations taking place in the courtyard outside my room. Second, it may be a result of asking for a single room but the bathroom sink and shower area were extremely small. I'm not a large man, but I was constantly bumping into the sides of the shower each morning. Overall, I was very impressed. While the hotel is more conducive to pleasure than business, I'd definitely return to this property when I return to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Rude Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelguy077
Reviews.Content: The Front Desk staff was so horrible at check-in and prior to our arrival, that we checked out early.
