Which you have to be careful of, because they don't tell you when you check-in that there is an early departure fee of $75. The best part about our stay was the wonderful waitress at the off-site restaurant we went to for breakfast. The GM needs to go there and see what great customer/guest service is. There are too many unemployed people that would be happy to have a job. And the carpet in the room was dirty and had large stains on it.

Reviews.Title: “Not so much”
Reviews.Author: cdiana2
Reviews.Content: The Hacienda is beautiful but the service not so much. A friend dropped me at the hotel to register before we went for dinner and I was told "parking is free across the street." The lot, and everywhere around, was filled. Understandable in a city, of course. Half an hour later we had to return to hotel and pay large overnight parking fee without being told we could park for few hours for much less. When I explained to desk I got an argument. Finding my hotel room was almost impossible because hotel is a maze spread throughout eight buildings at different levels--desk acted like I was an idiot for not understanding their directions--they didn't mention you have to go back to parking garage and cross street to get to building I was staying in. To get to the restaurant on top floor, it took two elevators, one back in parking garage. But, the Acapulco restaurant was amazingly good and service was excellent. The hotel is spread out all over a hill--gorgeous grounds, but extremely difficult to navigate--absolutely impossible for people who have a hard time walking. I picked this hotel because it offered free internet and shuttle to airport. Internet didn't work (other guests complained, too) and the first shuttle left at 7:00am, much too late for my early flight. I paid $20.00 for a cab after being told there was no coffee---not a good way to start a long travel day. Gorgeous room, gorgeous place, but I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, caution on shuttle times”
Reviews.Author: mjacostausmc
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in great location. Atmosphere is second to none. Would recommend without a problem. Watch out with their free airport shuttle times. Had an early flight and wanted to leave the hotel at 530am, but courtesy van didn't start until 7am. Regardless, the front desk clerks worked through the night to find a cab and ensure that it was there at 530 am on time. Nice service. Room was clean and roomy, location is great, ambiance and decor was fantastic. By the way, if you do have to take a cab, it only cost about $13.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Old Town”
Reviews.Author: wigsy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now the location is fantastic right in the heart of San Diego's Old Town. Great lanscaping and hotel has a great Southwest feel to it. The rooms are nice and clean. The staff is very helpful. The restaurant Acapulco'sm is good and reasonable. Will return again

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Vegasnative45
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times and enjoyed every one! I love the character of the whole property, the trees, flowers, the fountains and the views. The staff is friendly and helpful and quick to respond to problems. There is a great selection of restaurants and shopping a short walk from your room, and only 5 minutes from the beaches, stadium, Sea World etc.. Sure, the decor is a bit outdated, and the shower amenities are not as luxurious as a 5 star hotel, but I'll just bring my own.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room, Great Location and Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: necpix
Reviews.Content: I'm a 4-star hotel staying chick. But since we were staying 1 night to celebrate my son's bday by going to a Padres game my husband asked me to find a resonable place. I'm proud to say that I was completely satisfied with this hotel. The room was clean. Very important to me. We stayed in the 500 bldg, 2 queens with a view. The room even had a small sitting area. Great for the boys to play with their cars & legos. There was a flat screen TV, refrigerator, coffee maker & microwave. Beware of the possible charge if you open the coffee & bottle water. Note, there is a $12 a day parking fee and a $5 resort fee but you can park across the street for free. (and what hotel nowadays doesn't have "fees") The beds were fine and we could hear the person in the room above us stomping around a few times but nothing major. The pool was nice and enjoyed the courtyard and fountains of the hotel. We ate at Acapulco's which is on site. Again, food & service were great. We then took a stroll down to the center of Old Town. Many folks walking and eating at the local restaurants even on a Tuesday night. Enjoyed learning about the history of Old Town and looking at the shops. To top the evening off, as we were about to go into our room we could see the fireworks from Sea World. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. It's nothing to write home about BUT if you are looking for a clean & resonable place to stay consider it. Use your AAA card and get a discounted rate with some free perks and ask for a renovated room. Oh, and the young ladies at check in/out were very friendly. Good experienced for my first Best Western stay and Old Town visit. And the San Diego Padres won 13-3.

Reviews.Title: “Could Have Been Alot Better”
Reviews.Author: 4wanderers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Old Town for a week and stayed here 1 night. The other nights we stayed in the Old Town Holiday Inn Express. We MUCH preferred the Old Town Holiday Inn Express. The Best Western was more expensive and the rooms were dark and dingy. The walk to the pool was super long and the parking was bad. The beds were not comfortable and the carpet looked like it needed to be pulled up. If you have another option, then skip this hotel and head down the road to the Holiday Inn Express. Costly and the rooms are old and run down. They didn't even have cable on their 1980's TV.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Old Town”
Reviews.Author: DLB06
Reviews.Content: Great location! Walk all over Old Town and if you want to go into San Diego take the trolley. Room was a huge suite, beds were comfortable. The service was great. Cable went out and they had it fixed very fast. No breakfast on sight, but you get cupon for free one at a local diner.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute but ideal for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: JKB59
Reviews.Content: While on holiday in Huntington Beach, we visited San Diego for a day and liked it so much we decided to stay overnight. We were dropped off in Old Town by the trolley tour and decided to check into the Hacienda. The last minute deal we were given was great, and the small but spotlessly clean room was great value for money. Good location. Great city.

Reviews.Title: “like staying at a phrat house”
Reviews.Author: fooser23
Reviews.Content: location great, but when it came time to sleep the party outside our went on for hours even after repeated calls to front desk. So no sleep for our east coast family. Wouldn't recommend it for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, free shuttle a plus”
Reviews.Author: energizer0_0
Reviews.Content: We stayed over three nights at the Hacienda coming off a cruise. Our choice was based on location, close to Old Town San Diego. We were pleasantly surprised to find it was, just like the ads said, right at the edge of the old historic district. The Transit Centre is only a 10 minute walk away and the transit actually works. We had planned to rent a car but found we didn't need to. Free shuttle service to and from the San Diego Cruise Terminal and the airport was another big draw: saved maybe $50 in taxi fares. The included breakfast isn't on site, it is at "O'Hungry's" restaurant a (short) block down the street. Not quite as good as being in the same building but we didn't mind. The hotel comprises a number of buildings all built on the side of a hill. The layout is very up-.and-down: agreed, it's not for the mobility impaired. It was easy to take a wrong turn on our way up, down, and across to the office. The room itself was lovely: more like a small suite than a room. Great view out over San Diego. The building certainly isn't new but all furnishings, appliances, fixtures etc were in good working order. A malfunctioning plug in the bath tub was replaced quickly by their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but dated rooms. Iron stained my shirt.”
Reviews.Author: suhnshine
Reviews.Content: The location is good, but the rooms are old and a bit worn. The iron made a stain on my shirt. I would spend a bit more and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within one block walking distance to everything Old Town has to offer. Clean, big rooms, friendly staff, and free airport shuttle. Even though we had stomping children above our room and a toilet that was not working properly, I would still go back to this hotel. Great value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: JAMA293
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful with lots of character. Stayed in the 600 building high on the hill. Beds were comfy and rooms spacious with refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, safe, etc. We had two queen beds with twin size sofabed. Room faced the bay, had a great view. I could hear low freeway traffic noise, and at night a little walking/running noise from room above me, but nothing excessive and not while I was sleeping. I loved the character of this place, location, and landscaping. Parked across the street to avoid the parking fee. Front desk staff were nice about fixing a problem with my reservation (I had accidentally picked the wrong day to start the reservation).

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Hidden Fees!”
Reviews.Author: marktaco
Reviews.Content: I booked this room via the internet at a price, with taxes, of just over $145 for a King Suite for the night of January 29th, 2010. We arrived and discovered that the guest parking was $12.00 additional per night. This was curious since a "sandwich" board sign out front advertised public parking for $5 per night. I found it interesting that a non-guest can park for $7 per night less than a guest! The hotel is very conveniently located in Old Town. The grounds, courtyards, etc. are beautiful in and in very good condition. Our room, a king suite, had very dated furniture and carpeting. Both my wife and I expected more for a $145 king suite and were disappointed. The room was clean and neat. The bathroom was very, very small. Upon check out, the hotel added a mandatory "resort fee" of $5. When I showed them my printed confirmation sheet of just over $145 and no such fee, the clerk said the web site shows the fee and that I had to pay it. I did. When I got home, I rechecked their web site and on line reservation system. It's deceiving at best. When you book, the reservation confirmation page shows a grand total, including tax, but no "resort fee". To find this, you have to click on the terms and conditions section in small font and read completely through it to find the $5. Seems to me that all mandatory fees should be shown in the final total on the main reservation confirmation page, like taxes were. However, they buried this mandatory fee in another web page, creating an allusion of a lower rate. Because I view such practices to be deceptive, I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Hollymount97
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights and was really impressed with the hotel, the staff, and the location - plus it was great value for money! The hotel is located in the middle of Old Town and you have immediate access to a large variety of Mexican restaurants and bars, plus the attractions of Old Town. It is also only a 10min walk to the trolley station which you can catch into downtown San Diego. Will definitely stay here on my next visit to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, clean and comfortable with good fascilites”
Reviews.Author: PenelopevanSchliffe
Reviews.Content: The hotel charges for parking, however there is a free car park right accross the street. The reception staff were friendly and welcoming and the area was really cozy and relaxed with the fireplace and newspapers and free computer access. The suite was quiet, clean and comfortable. We had facilities for preparing simple meals and a fridge and room safe. There's a pool and hottub too. The laundry room was a great facility too. The location is great for shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the mobility-impaired”
Reviews.Author: tilden717
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week over the Thanksgiving holiday and our feelings were mixed. We had booked a "suite", only to find out that it appeared to be a regular-sized room, divided into two. Between the king-sized bed and the tv wardrobe, there was barely any available floor space in the bedroom. We asked to be moved to another room and the management was very prompt about responding to our request. The hotel itself is very comfortable and pretty with a nice restaurant attached, but it is constructed in about 8 separate buildings, that are connected by plazas, stairways and elevators. My husband is blind and has a guide dog and it was not easy for him to move around between the buildings. I would not recommend it for those who have mobility issues.

Reviews.Title: “SAN DIEGO STOP-OVER”
Reviews.Author: HeatherF6
Reviews.Content: lovely; great restaurant for Sunday brunch; rooms were huge; with different buildings lots of privacy; great location to visit old town San Diego

Reviews.Title: “A Dream of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rejserole
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Best Western Old Town from date 3-6.09.09, just 5 min walk from the fascinating area Old Town in San Diego. The hotel are build in Mexican style, with many different areas, with palmes, trees, pool area and a beautiful view over San Diego. When all the lights has been shut on in the nighttime, you feel yourself in an other world it is" A Dream of a Hotel". The outside public parking area direct in front of the hotel, and also parking inside the hotel area, gives a free choice for parking your car, in walking distance from the Old Town , we feel it very nice, special at the night time. All rooms are build in old style with furniture in wood, free internet access, and a clean nice bath room. Visiting the surrounding Old Town area, is like to be in the 18 century with houses, places, Haciendas in "Zorro "styles , and Sea World, just 10 min by car away, gives you all what you need to get a great stay in San Diego, even for a short 3 days stay. No dout about it, we stay at this hotel again in 2010 Jeppesen fammely Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: VogliaDiVolare
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I planned a last minute trip to San Diego. He had never been before, so he left the hotel booking to me! I was familiar with San Diego and was so surprised to see that this hotel popped up within our price range! (Less than $100 per night!! on a weekend!!) We were thrilled to book it, and upon arrival knew it was the best decision! Old Town is a great great area of San Diego, pretty central to everything! The hotel is right in the middle of it all! Great restaurants and fun shops are just a block away! If you don't have a car, the trolley stop to get around is a 5 min walk from the hotel....The hotel has the loveliest mexican/spanish feel and architecture to it! Its just delightful even just walking around it....The entire staff was friendly and helpful, and quick to respond to our needs....The hotel has wireless, complimentary amenities/coffee, a restaurant.....The only down side was having to pay for overnight parking!....So whether its your first time to San Diego, or its a second home to you, I completely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “too many issues”
Reviews.Author: mabbsy
Reviews.Content: Rang for hotel shuttle from SD airport to be told it would be ten minutes. It was, but by then a large family had also turned up to wait for it. When the shuttle arrived it couldn`t fit us all in and we, being British, allowed the family to go ahead and said we`d wait for the shuttle to return. "twenty to twenty-five minutes" the driver said. An hour later I rang the hotel again and, eventually they sent another bus to get us. On arrival (around 1pm) we were told that our room wasn`t ready. "Fair enough" I thought because, although lots of other people`s rooms DID seem to be ready, I`d booked us a king suite as a bit of a treat. At 3pm we were checked in only to find we`d been given an ordinary room with 2 queens. There was much muttering behind the desk when I showed them my reservation and we were then told that the king suite wasn`t ready and wouldn`t be ready for a while. By now, we were getting tired, so I said we`d take the ordinary room but they`d have to knock something off the price. They agreed to knock 20 dollars per night off the room (yes - I know I should have held out for more, and normally I would, but as I said we were getting tired by now). So we took the offered room which was ok. I`d been worried about noise due to the hotel`s proximity to the Freeway / airport / trainlines etc but heard nothing from these at night. You`re more likely to be disturbed by people talking outside your room due to the hotel`s layout. All the rooms open straight onto attractive landing areas (some with built in BBQS) where people like to linger and chat. Pool area was very nice and there were loads of restaurants (mainly mexican food) nearby. Personally, I wouldn`t stay in the old town again because we`ve been to San Diego several times previously and this just didn`t feel like SD.

Reviews.Title: “Unadvertised Add-on Fees”
Reviews.Author: sorre
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hacienda on Sept 11, 2009. We have stayed here several times in the past. At check-in were told that there would be a daily parking fee of $12.95 per day (we were not charged for parking in our past stays). You could decline the parking fee but would have to search for parking in adjacent locations but depending on when you park your vehicle this can be quite a task. At check-in we were also advised of an add-on fee of $5.00 to offset the cost of coffee (previously complementary) and two small bottles of water. This fee was not negotiable. Curiously, the Hacienda offered parking to non-guests for $5.00. I am not sure if the fee was for just daily parking and not overnight parking. Prior notice of these fees would be the ethical thing to do. I was not happy with the imposed fees so I ended our three day reservation after one day after making reservations elsewhere where there were no unadvertised add-on fees. I was charged a $75.00 plus tax penalty fee for leaving early. I can assure you that we will not stay at the Hacienda again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: cheaptravelbug
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel for $135 for one night, the standard suite. Overall its not a bad hotel, got some character for Best Western chain. Definitely has the "Old Town" spanish influence. Its on a huge lot with the units towering over the hill. The room was a basic suite with a study area with the TV by the entrance and the bedroom off towards the window, we had a view. Spacious, fairly clean, nothing spectacular but no major issues. The hotel really is nice for the location, its IN "Old Town" You can walk out and turn the corner and you are right where all the restaurants and bars are. Old Town doesn't have much choices in terms of hotels in town so I wouldn't mind staying here again. Price isn't bad for San Diego. Its a basic hotel with a bit of character in prime location at a decent price. ***Red Trolli is within short walk by the park, it takes you all the way down to the border if you feel like making a quick trip down to Mexico and don't feel like taking your car. We took a cab from the border to Rosarito for $15.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: fhughes47
Reviews.Content: The hotel is attractive in traditional Spanish style. It is located on a hill overlooking the city, and is within easy walking distance of the entire Old Town area. The staff is friendly and helpful. Avoid the hotel restaurant. The food is mediocre, and here are many better restaurants in easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Nice Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: RebelTraveler07
Reviews.Content: Old Town is splendid for so many reasons: great restaurants & shops; close to the trolleys--if you want to venture out of Old Town to other areas. Best Western Hacienda is pretty nice--in the heart of Old Town! Here are the pros & cons of the property: PROS: Reasonable enough rate; FREE Internet in your room; pretty roomy; gorgeous landscaping all over the facility; close to everything--restaurants, shops, the train station for trolleys are a quick walk away; granted us a 1pm check out; FREE shuttle to & from the airport; cordial bell staff. CONS: It's a bit of a hike from the lobby to your room...We had to go through 3 elevators to get there. Fine for us, but may be a bit of a pain for those with some walking troubles; slightly outdated decor, but okay for the price; front desk staff was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “really comfortable large rooms and spotlessly clean, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: VW2803
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for Old Town restaurants and sites. Hotel is lovely, old mexican style. Pool just lovely too. The 800 building although at the front was excellent spot. Would not hesitate to book there again. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, can't wait to come back down to Old Town.”
Reviews.Author: ladeee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my friends this past weekend and loved the hotel so much that I'm bringing my husband back in September. It's located in such a convenient location, the hotel itself is just charming and the view is just incredible. The elevators are a little slow and I wasn't too thrilled at having to pay for parking as a hotel guest but those are my only complaints (there are stairs everywhere on the property and ample parking on the street).

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, perfect location...best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: AZGoddess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for the second time at the Best Western Hacienda Hotel in Old Town, San Diego for a quick weekend getaway. We had such a great time...we are loyal customers to this hotel. The staff is very friendly, and the location is ideal. It's so great to be able to just park your car once, and be within walking distance to Old Town, with lots of shopping and restaurants like Fred's. We had a gorgeous view, with a perfect room with a nice balcony, overlooking the pool. It's a nice, quiet hotel, even while being over the pool! The decor is nice, and the lack of noise was amazing. Even with a wedding reception going on below, we still slept great!

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite As Good As We Remembered”
Reviews.Author: Busy-retired
Reviews.Content: A decade ago we spent several nights each year at this charming hotel. It was one of our most favorite places to stay, and even though it was above our budget we always found the money to indulge in the delights of this lovely hotel. We returned to San Diego recently after having not been in the town for more than ten years. We know that ten years is a long time in the life of a hotel, but we made reservations hoping things had not changed for the worse. The good news: The hotel has attempted to keep up with the times by adding small refrigerators and microwaves as well as internet access. Drapes and spreads were fairly up-to-date, and the old Spanish-style furniture still looked good. Our room was fairly large, with a decent-sized bathroom. Service is still a high-priority. A problem in the bathroom was fixed within minutes of our report. The bad news: Internet access is via cable so only one of us could work on a computer, which was a huge inconvenience for us. We were surprised that wireless was not available. In the past our rooms were always located under shady roofs surrounded by luxurious bougainvillea, over-looking interesting little gardens. This year we were placed in a building that overlooked a parking lot which did not even belong to the hotel. No special feelings from this view unless you want to compare it to a motor court of the 1950's. The absolutely fantastic restaurant in the hotel is under different management and a new menu and we will probably never taste lime-roasted chicken again. What a pity! The first quoted price of $159/night would have been totally outrageous for this hotel, even though it does enjoy a good location. Our negotiated price of $120/night was still excessive for what we received. Two random thoughts: It is silly to include a parking charge with a hotel room for which 90% of guests will have reached via automobile. Just add the charge to the room cost. This hotel had the cheapest toilet paper I have ever used, and that includes some not very nice places in third world nations. I did not understand why they "skimped" on something like this.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, not so nice staff”
Reviews.Author: artbird88
Reviews.Content: We checked in and were greeted by a very dry and unwelcoming front desk staff. The girls at the counter weren't friendly or helpful at all. After some confusion of finding our room and parking in the crazy roundabout parking garage, we settled in to what seemed like a freshly remodeled room. There was a weird sort of toxic smell in our room that I think was coming from the new carpet, it was mildly headache inducing. But aside from that our room was very lovely, and there was a mini fridge and microwave, which is always nice. All of the fixtures seemed new in there. The grounds were lovely and nice to walk around. We weren't put into the haunted section of buildings, so nothing to report there. We set out into Old Town looking for dinner and to just poke around, and it seemed that more places then not just felt very unfriendly, or maybe they are tired of tourists. Which was kind of sad since I had such good memories of the place from when I was a child. It's funny you would think that a place that thrives on the tourist dollar would make more of an effort to be a little friendlier, but no such luck. But if you are looking for a lovely place to stay right there in Old Town, this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Aggressive manager”
Reviews.Author: deannamg
Reviews.Content: They have a sign out front for $10 parking. We parked inside and they have a machine that takes cash only. I went into the lobby with my 3 kids to ask where I could find a ATM. The girl at the front desk was very rude and tried to direct me to a bar 3 blocks away. When I pointed to my kids (a bar?) she became even ruder, I walked out. The manager (Douglas frost) is a very aggressive 50+ mail. After being treated badly by the girl in the lobby. My 3 children and I went out front. The manager came out and was yelling at me, cursing at me and followed me and my 3 children (13,7 and 4) down the street. Dropping the f word the whole way. He never once asked what happened inside just took what she said and yelled at me and would not stop. It was unbelievable and I am still in complete shock! Douglas is much taller than me and came with in inches of me telling me to "get the F out of here" (I was not even in front of their hotel) My 4 year old daughter was terrified, clinging to my leg.

Reviews.Title: “Why Didn't I Stay Here Before”
Reviews.Author: Mitchsgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so convenient to old town, which I regularly frequent. I normally stay at another Old Town hotel but this was a spur of the moment trip and that hotel was booked so I checked online and found this one. What a great surprise. This hotel was very clean and everyone from the front desk to the gardener was so friendly and helpful. Great value for the money. I will definately stay here again. I have also recommended it to my friends that normally stay in other areas of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Should communicate better...”
Reviews.Author: craftyca
Reviews.Content: I made the reservation for a king and I also stated in the comments that I would prefer a room with a view. Arrived to check in and they did have a room with a view. Went to our room and it was a queen, not a king and the view was partially of the city but also a palm tree smack in the middle of the view. Called the front desk and they said that it was an upgrade because I have a "view". There are also a LOT of stairs and the layout is very confusing. Nice hotel for the price. And there is one computer in the lobby and it was being repaired. Although I did not rent a car, I don't think that hotel guests should have to pay for parking on top of their room rate!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, noisy, noisy - but beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: IslandParents
Reviews.Content: This place was a disappointment. The setting is lovely, the grounds are beautifully kept and immaculately landscaped, the staff are good. Housekeeping was not good though: by 4 pm on our second day we had to go find someone to beg some clean towels and TP off of, and they were not that busy. Parking fee is a rip-off as are the GOUGING resort fees. The restaurant is not very good (worst of all places we ate). Old, tired bathroom with a toilet that did not flush properly - not very romantic. Overwhelming I5 traffic noise, and airport noise really ruined the otherwise nice setting. Transport this to another location, fix the bathroom and get better housekeeping, and I would possibly go back. As it is, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, interesting layout, great location”
Reviews.Author: ruky
Reviews.Content: We loved the layout of this 5 acre hotel although we had difficulty finding our rooms. The hotel is beautiful with amazing views of the city. The location is perfect for walking around Old Town San Diego. The staff were very helpful and accommodating. My only complaint would be that the showers were not the greatest. But not a huge deal in my books. I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you have any sort of mobility issues though as there are a lot of stairs and you need to walk a fair distance to use the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Old Town. Beautiful hotel but rude and unpleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: HapaKLM
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed here several times before since we always enjoyed our rooms and the service, but this time when I went with my boyfriend the hotel staff was terrible! I put in a request when I first reserved our room for a certain room that my folks and I used to stay in. I was told there was no guarantees that I'd get that room (which was fine) but they'd be as accommodating as they could to give me a similar room. When my boyfriend and I went to check in the woman staff member that helped us was already unfriendly. She didn't seem like she knew what she was doing. She assigned us a room without looking at the special request I put in and when I mentioned my request she then stated that "someone, not her accidentally gave that room away that day." If she simply said that room wasn't available I'd be fine, but "accidentally" gave it away doesn't sound right to me. I then asked if I could get a similar room to what I originally requested and so she booked my boyfriend and me into room 411. Do not stay in that room! It has to be one of the worst rooms on the property. When we got to the room we were very surprised. Walls were paper thin (could hear the neighbors the whole time), extremely small and has absolutely no view. I felt like we got downgraded from what we were originally supposed to have. We were paying 139 a night plus $12 dollars parking so we most certainly were not happy with this tiny room. When my boyfriend and I went back downstairs to request another room the manager came out and assured us that all the rooms were similar in size. The manager and his employees need to actually go through all the rooms on the property to see how very different they all are. Very unprofessional of them to say the rooms are all similar in size. By his definition, similar most definitely sucked. Since I have stayed at this hotel several times I know this not to be true. That is, the rooms are not all similar in size. Of the rooms I know I've stayed in is 403 and 407. Those rooms are both much much bigger than 411 and we paid much less for those rooms! What makes those rooms better is they have high ceilings, two full size beds (I believe they're full size and not queen), one fold out couch and a sitting area/patio right outside the room to enjoy a gorgeous San Diego sunset/sunrise and other views. I know my family has also stayed in the buildings higher up the hill which had similar layouts. Since the manager seemed to be just bs'ing around and it was obvious he wasn't trying hard to find us another room we said "forget it since its too much of an inconvenience for you" and had to stay in our miserable room. As if things couldn't get any worse, when we checked out of our room they charged us twice for parking!! So I had to go back in and at get refunded. The refund is the only thing they did right if you can even consider that right since they screwed up already. Gesh! These people must have never gotten any real training before being put at the front desk. Thankfully we didn't stay in our room all that much since there is lots of great eating to do in Old Town like Old Town Mexican Restaurant which makes fresh warm flour and corn tortillas right in front of you. Although this hotel is in the best location of Old Town San Diego, know you've been warned. Staff used to be nice, but as my review and current previous other reviews show, helpful staff is out of the question nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “great location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: haru2
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the location, which was very nice and convenient. The room was clean and I liked that. But I didn't like their attitude for customers. My BF noticed that we had no hot water after starting to take a shower in the morning, and I called the front desk. A lady told me she would sent someone soon, which was true. Unfortunately, my BF already took a water shower so he told the plumber not to come in. (Because of the conversation with the lady, I assumed that the water heater was inside of the room but probebly it was outside, I guess) well, I know he showed up as soon as possible and I really appreciate it. However, the bad thing is that the lady at front desk called us and started arguing by saying it was us to ask for fixing the water heater. Is this a right thing?? I'm not American, but with my country's common sense, this is not right. I wanted to talk with the manager when we checked out, but I didn't. Since there was other customer who asked for the manager. I could kind of see the level of this hotel by this.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: superstarintheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed few days in San Diego at this hotel,was our first time in town and we enjoyed the hotel. It has a free shuttle to and from the airport ( it's close to the hotel), by a walk you can reach the historic park, restaurants, shops and the bus centre where you can get many buses that bring you almost everywhere ( included Seaworld so you don't have to pay tons of money for organized tours, and you reach the park in about 10 minutes). In the historic park there is the main stop of the Trolley Bus, you can take it and visiting the town with hop - on hop - off, so it's a short walk from the hotel. The hotel is very big, is almost like a little town at least for us who come from a little village in Europe, there is a restaurant but it serves only mexican dishes ( at least, if like us you don't like it, you can survive with their only non mexican dish: chips and chicken). There are swimming pools in an open area, open until night. The rooms are big, clean, the staff is friendly, there is a man who works specifically for tourist's excursions ( from there you can book a lot of excursions including in Mexico). The only problem is that when we booked we did not know about extra fees, they were not too much ( something like 70 dollars for the whole stay), but our travel agent did not tell us, maybe 'cuz he did not know it, so just ask before you go :) PS: we had the flight to come back to europe at 6am so we chosed to don't book last night and sleep in the airport, if you are planning to do like us, DON'T! the airport at san diego is close in the night!

Reviews.Title: “Haunted Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: RockyHarada
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for location, which is terriffic. We stayed in room #407, would not recommend that room. Felt spooky, eerie, and creepy. The bathroom door closed and opened by itself, the toilet kept flushing itself. We asked for another room, and got moved to the top floor, a very nice bright room. Told the maintenance man what we experienced, he said THAT ROOM WAS A DISASTER, ALWAYS something happening!!! I am not superstitious, I am completely honest in stating that room is haunted!! It happens to be right above the Whaley House, which has that problem too. If you book a room here, request the top level, way up high on the hill!!. Do not stay in room # 407!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: NMacKay
Reviews.Content: The hotel had fairly large, comfortable rooms with a sofa. The location is right in Old Town, perfect for walking everywhere. We had an issue where we didn't have any water at all coming into our suite for a couple of hours, and with a little negotiation, they didn't charge us for parking as compensation. The hot tub is great. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, not impressed with room”
Reviews.Author: SteelersFan27
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Hacienda Hotel and stayed in the 700 building, which is on the same level of the lobby. The outside area of the resort was very nice and fit in beautifully with the Old Town "Spanish" feel. We were pretty disappointed with our room though. The carpet needed to be replaced, this was really the main thing that bothered us. It was visibly worn and dirty. The bathroom also could have used updating. For as expensive as it was, we expected much more. We did enjoy a little time at the pool though, nice view. Aside from the room, the location in Old Town San Diego was terrific! It's very close to the Historical Park, which was neat. The main street through the area was also packed with Mexican restaurants and cafes. We loved the Cafe Coyote across the street and Fred's Mexican Cafe up the street. The area had a small town feel and we felt very safe and comfortable, but it was still a fun, festive feel in the evenings! Some San Diego notes: -very easy to navigate in a car! -Gaslamp District seemed nice, but we visited around lunchtime and it definitely seemed to be more of a night spot. Lots of clubs, but plenty of good restaurants too! -Coronado Island is a MUST SEE! We had a terrific day and it is just a beautiful area. If I were returning to San Diego, I would stay in either Old Town again or in Coronado, but not at the Hacienda Hotel- unless I knew they did some renovations/updates. It definitely had the best location in Old Town, but I would probably look into the other hotels in the area, they might be nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of hidden charges!”
Reviews.Author: kelleygirl52
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through the hotel's website 3 months before hand. The package deal said all hotel taxes,etc. were included. Good thing I printed the package details because shortly thereafter I recieved a e-mail with our reservation, but they added almost one hundred dollars in taxes and fees. I contacted the manager and he said they would honor the original price. Fast forward 3 months...Upon check in, I verifed the taxes,etc. were included in my package. I was assured everything was on track. When we checked out, they again tried to charge the fees. Again I was told they would honor our original agreement. When I got home I checked my credit card statement and they had charged my card for the amount after I left. It took almost a week of leaving messages to finally get my card credited back. They also charge $12 a night to park when there is plenty of street parking (one night there was no parking on property so we had to park on the street anyway!) "Resort fee' of $5 is also a joke. Such a shame because we really enjoyed staying there, just bad management!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kek1781
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Best Western Hacienda for the week, and I cannot rave enough about the great location of the hotel. Located right in the heart of Old Town San Diego, there are great Mexican restaurants and shopping right outside your door. Unfortunately, the location is the only thing I would rate as "Excellent". The rooms were a bit out of date, they could definitely use some updates, especially in the decor-area. The rooms were very, very dark. Not what I would expect in sunny San Diego. I believe my room was especially noisy. I stayed in the 700 building which backs up to the restaurants on the main street. Every morning at 5:30, the garbage truck would back up outside my window and unload the dumpster. Even on Sundays. I also had an adjoining room to a family of four. I could hear every single thing through the door between our rooms, including bathroom noises (not to be too graphic...) We also booked our rooms with the El Presidente package. It entitled us to a free breakfast and free dinner (with two free drinks). The breakfast was decent, especially the days when they had French Toast which was really good. The dinners were okay, with a very limited menu. We chose to eat in town quite a few nights and pass up the free dinners. Strangely, being a part of the El Presidente package also seemed to limit where you were allowed to sit in the restaurant. It would have been nice to eat outside. Overall, I think the hotel is a good value. The location is great and within walking distance of a lot of great sites. I probably would not recommend the hotel if you planned on staying indoors all day!

Reviews.Title: “Love ALMOST everything about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: McC60
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location! Lots to do and see, while I do admit to there being an overabundance of Mexican food restaurants. The hotel itself is lovely. Beautiful, well kept grounds and flowers pots. Very clean. Had no trouble with staff . Our room was generously large, clean and comfy. It had a sitting area, something we weren't expecting. There is a resort fee that goes for the coffe and 2 bottles of water daily - oh, well. Parking is $12/day, but can I just say "suck it up and pay for it" as parking is at a premium in the area and finding free parking may take you a lot of time, plus the parking at the hotel is in/out and in a garage, so that's a plus. Unless you're desperate or lazy, don't go to the hotel's restaurant - there's better and CHEAPER in Old Town. Lots of shops and restaurants there - try Cafe Coyote - one of the best! Try and go at off times, otherwise you'll wait ... and wait...and that goes for ALL of the restaurants there. The pool isn't large, and even though the hotel is, it was never overcrowed. The hotel is also close to Ocean Beach and Mission Beach (10-15 mins). The cliffs in Ocean Beach are simply amazing at sunset - plan on it! We took a ghost tour, something fun, not scary, but historical. Do the one at 11pm if you're going to do it - there aren't as many people around..adds to the ambiance of the tour. It is aboout a 45 walking tour, but doesn't go too far. Enjoy your stay at the Hacienda - one of the best hotels we've stayed in in years!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MazandNeil
Reviews.Content: This was undoubtedly the best hotel of the 10 or so we stayed at during our last visit to the US. The rooms were comfortable and a good size, the hotel had a laundry (necessary after 7 days on the road) and was very close to the Old Town - great place to spend an evening. The only downsides were: 1 - exorbitant parking charge - $17 per night 2 - restaurant was okay but not great, although this is based just on breakfast 3 - they could only accommodate us for 1 night - the 2nd night of our stay in SD was spent in a Motel 6. INDESCRIBABLE!!!! Bur don't worry about any of these minor problems - this is a classy hotel - even by European standards! Marianne & Neil

Reviews.Title: “I can't get enough of this place”
Reviews.Author: GordonJohnstone
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I used to come to San Diego on business a lot from England. I stayed in many other hotels but this was the nicest. Not formal, very laid back. Staff were great with my teen kids (13 and 18), and very respectful to us. Mexican room service staff were very friendly and helpful. Views are stunning from the upper floors. This time we stayed in the 700 block of mini suites, downstairs. Perfect. If you have a big family or more money than sense, you can get two mini suites side by side and there are double doors both sides which can be opened to make a huge suite. Outside there is a little seating area with a fountain that the humming birds come to drink from. Lovely. Oh and theres a Coldstones thats about a 2 minute walk away for those hot San Diegan nights.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel; great value”
Reviews.Author: dgcb
Reviews.Content: We wanted to go to Sea World and had seen they had packages. I called the hotel directly, got an excellent rate (equiv to $149/night considering it included two adult Sea World tickets and $9 off each of the kid tickets. I know 149 doesn't sound excellent, but for the area, it is. Hotel Circle is comparable and the beach is more. El Cajon is cheaper, but that would be pretty much the only pro there). The hotel is very picturesque, with separate red-roofed buildings at different levels and a water fountain with changing light colors outside of our room. We were in building three and were able to park in the parking garage and walk out directly onto the level where our room was. Perhaps since our home is in a city we weren't bothered by noise. It was there, but basically as a mild, steady white noise rather than hearing cars rumble by constantly. Don't know where you'd stay and not have some kind of noise. We did not have any bothersome noises like people out partying or talking at all hours. Service at the hotel was excellent from the time I made the call, to check-in (where they had everything ready for us as soon as we got there, with no waiting whatsoever) to the maid who gave us another soap immediately when I needed it. The only real con for us was the service in the on-site restaurant, which was inconsistent, very poor the first time with long waits, but very quick the next time even tho it was busier. We will definitely stay here again and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: worktravelseattle
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is extremely rude and inconsiderate. I had difficulty cancelling a reservation due to unforeseen circumstances. Not only was the staff not attentive to my needs by putting me on hold for ages, they still charged me for a night's stay! When I proceeded to straighten out the problem, the manager's only argument was that her staff NEVER makes mistakes. I guess I was the one who made the mistake in booking this hotel in the first place. This is by far the worst experience I have ever had with a hotel. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but breakfast is a minus”
Reviews.Author: Rt66tbird
Reviews.Content: Hillside arrangement gives a very different experience. Allows for pretty landscaping and views. Fountains and flowers are wonderful. Elevators eliminate stairs if desired. Rooms are spacious. Front desk and bellstaff are excellent. Proximity to Old Town and the many dining spots is a definite plus. Breakfast in the Hacienda's Acapulco Room is not the best. It is hard for me to understand why the hotel allows this negative to continue to marr what is a very nice property.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gemela01
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels, I always stay here when I visit San Diego. Close to where you want to be. Great service & ammenities. It gives you a feeling as if you were in a Hacienda in Mexico. Very comfortable suites, great views of the city. Lots of things to do near by.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK; deceptive advertising”
Reviews.Author: flipper314
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hacienda for 3 nights at $149/night. The best thing about the Hacienda is its location: right in Old Town. But overall we were quite disappointed. The walls are paper-thin: we heard all our neighbors on all sides. No newspaper was delivered to the room (more on newspapers below). The pool is very small (though it does have a nice view). The worst part is all the deceptive advertising which left a bad aftertaste to our stay. First, our room was advertised as a "suite", when in fact it was a single room. Second, and most galling, was the added $5 "resort fee". I booked directly thru the Best Western website and this fee was never mentioned, but when we checked in we were told it was mandatory for all guests. Surprise! What makes the fee worse is how pathetic the reason for the fee is: to pay for free newspapers and coffee in the lobby and two bottles of water a day. Well, "free newspapers" means one copy each of three newspapers in the lobby, mounted on wooden poles like they use in libraries, so you can forget about taking a copy to your room, and you may well have to wait your turn to read it. (On top of that, the papers were all a day old!) The coffee was cheap Farmer Brothers, just terrible. Which leaves the water which, at $2.50/bottle, is surely the most expensive water ever. Note that this hotel is on a steep hillside, and has many, many stairs (127 from the street to our room!). We found it charming, but if you can't handle stairs, this is not the hotel for you. Parking is $12/day. To the hotel's credit, they did point out the free parking lot across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: TheBanker12
Reviews.Content: This place was overall a great hotel. My wife and I enjoyed our stay and everyone seemed very nice. Pros and Cons are as follows: PROS: Great breakfast, which we received free with our stay. (I believe we made a special reseravtion for that) Perfect placement in Old Town. Perfect placement for all of your Old Town needs, no need to drive anywhere. Rooms were perfect, clean, and very beautiful. If you get the right room, the view is spectacular. Front staff was excellent. Quickly served us, and even made an extra pot of Decaf Coffee for my wife. She made this eventhough there were only 5 minutes left until the coffee was going to be taken away. I thought that was excellent customer service. We had a very quiet experience, no noise to complain about, and there were children staying next to us. CONS: Parking, Parking, Parking! If you want to park on the property it cost money, so we decided to park on the street. We did find a perfect parking place, but if it was busy I don't know where anyone would park. However, if you plan to stay in Old Town like we did, once you park you are not going to use your car again until you leave. Stairs! It is quite a big complex, so if you want to get around, expect to walk a lot. This was not a huge hassle for us, but it might be for some. That was it. Other then those two things, we had a pleasant stay. Everything was really nice. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “I really like this place, but it's not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: MEDRoswell
Reviews.Content: I qualify this review by stating that this is not a hotel for everyone, although personally I really enjoy staying here. Some of the things to consider before booking at the Hacianda Old Town. Do you like to walk and climb stairs? The hotel climbs quite steeply from the main street in Old Town and if you have a room in building 5 or 6 you could be in for a climb. Do dark rooms bother you? The hotel is in the motif of old Spanish California and the wood and lighting is rather dark. The rooms are clean and well kept, but hardly could be described as bright. Are you really bothered by traffic and airport noise? The 5 freeway is below the property and the hotel is adjacent to San Diego International Airport. So there is noise here. Do you have trouble parking in tight spaces? If you plan on renting an SUV or large car, parking in one of the tight spaces in the garages will challenge the best of drivers. Rent a small car. Now why my family and I love this hotel: The views from the top rooms are spectacular. We stay in building 6 which overlooks all of Old Town, San Diego Harbor, fireworks at Sea World, and a great view of the Sunset. We love the location, just steps from Old Town shopping and restaurants. The zoo and downtown are less than 5 minutes away as is Sea World. In the evenings you can step outside your room and smell the aromas from the restaurants below. We like the Old Spanish feel of the hotel. This place can be a real bargain considering the location and view. We paid just over $100 a night during Spring Break. This was our 4th stay at this property and we will keep coming back. Just note it may not be the place for every traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old Town Location, average room”
Reviews.Author: suethe
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, inside old town and the trolley. The rooms vary in size and ambience. Our room was very small (very clean) and we heard music and noise from the restaurant late into the evening (our room was just below the (..Acapulco restaurant). There was also a light outside of our room that was on all night and the wooden shades would not block out. Nice place for SMALL gatherings, 50 or fewer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: pookyCanada
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel in a perfect location in the Old Town and a few blocks away from one of the Old Trolley stop. Our room was spacious. The staff was accomodating and courteous. Everything was very clean. If you don't want to use the stairs (many) you can always use the elevators. I would definitively stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Best Western Hacienda”
Reviews.Author: kimberlyj
Reviews.Content: We just stayed two nights at the Best Western Hacienda. We had two adjoining rooms in the 600 building and our friends stayed in the 800 building. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The carpet was new. The front desk was helpful, although they informed our friends that they could park their RV in the parking lot across the street. This was not possible because parking spaces are minimal in this area. If you have an RV, I recommend parking it at a place called Campmor a few miles away. Great family hotel, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it the first time, hated it the second time”
Reviews.Author: Wynda
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second trip to Old Town San Diego where we stayed at the Hacienda Hotel again. The first time we stayed there it was great, very much like a 5 star hotel at a 3 star price. This last visit to the Hacienda was horrific, it's hard to believe it's the same hotel as before. Our room was located at the very back of the property in the 500 suite block. There was a side gate that was fairly close and provided easy access to Old Town. The proximity to Old Town was the only good thing about this trip. The room was very dated with stains on the carpet and the bathroom walls. The bathroom door was a sliding door that did not lock and got stuck every time we tried to close it. In order to close the door we had to lift it and then slide it. Our last room had vaulted ceilings that made the room feel large, this last room did not and it felt very much like being in a dungeon. We were surrounded by loud people with very young children who ran around making loud noises in the rooms above us and beside us. Obviously that was not the hotel's fault but it was very unpleasant. The lighting in the room was dim which only added to the feeling of being in a dungeon. If you stay at the Hacienda DO NOT let them book you in the 500 block. You will feel like you are in a Motel 6 if you do. The rooms that we raved about before were located at the front of the property near the lobby and were in the 100 or 200 block. I would stay at the Hacienda again if I could get a room in the front otherwise I would stay at another hotel. I'd also like to add that the check in was quick and so was the check out and that the staff was friendly and allowed us to check in a little early.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: sdsualum
Reviews.Content: Motel 6 is better. The people there are idiots and should not be allowed to work there. We first booked a room, Executive Suite, which they said had two bedrooms and two bathrooms. When we got in the room, it was a converted conference room with Murphy beds. We got them to change to two regular rooms. Everything seemed fine until we went to take a shower at 10 PM, No hot water. I let the water run for 10 minutes, no warm water even came out. We called the front desk, all we got was "Oh Sorry" Then when we checked out, my father in-law gave them his credit card to pay for his room, he signed his reciept and off he went. A week later, I noticed they charged his room to my credit card and allowed him to sign on it. They said they would reverse the charges and fix the problem, but it has been over a week and nothing. I can't get the managers to call me back just to confirm. I have called corporate offices, and they are trying to resolve it, but now the hotel is saying they don't know what I am talking about. I will never stay at this hotel with the rudiest, most uncourtesy staff of any hotel I have ever stayed at. And I have stayed at a lot of bad hotels. It is a great location, but it isn't worth the headaches. Check into Motel 6 on Hotel Circle, I guarentee it will be a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Clean, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ak33
Reviews.Content: This place is great - nice pool and hot tub. Nice food deal with the mexican restaurant next door. Our room was great - good view - and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hate it!”
Reviews.Author: Perso-Love-to-travel
Reviews.Content: We took a family vaction with our two children. We traveled with several other families. Our first inpression of the hotel was great. The ourside grounds were beautiful. So, we thought we would be ok. Boy, was I wrong. We went into the lobby to check in. The person who was checking us in tried to put us into a smaller room. I paid extra for a mini suit. I had to go to my car to get my confirmation letter. After that we got the correct room. I looked at the hotel print out and noticed several fees. There was a 5 dollar resort fee and 12 dollars in parking. I did not notice these fees on the web sight. I went back to look and it was in very small print on the bottom of the page. Why not included these fee in the web print out. I felt like I was tricked. We finally got into our room and noticed how small it was. Our friend payed for the average size room. His room and ours was the same size. The only difference was our room was divided in half by a full wall. His room was divided by a half wall. I was not happy paying more for my room. In the room was the smallest couch I have ever seem. It was barely big enough for two people. This was the pull out bed for our children. The pull out bed had a very thin mattress. The children could feel the support bar in the middle of the bed. My children could not sleep on the bed so they went to bed on the floor and used the mattress. I felt really bad for my children. I will never stay there again. The Marriott is down the street. The price is better and they have better beds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and well priced”
Reviews.Author: GIOBABIE1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in the heart of Old Town. There is a short walk to all of the attractions and resturants in Old Town. This hotel is on the hill and has wonderful views of the San Diego bay. I would definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good property in a great location”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustgyrl
Reviews.Content: Rooms: The hotel is decorated in California Spanish mission style, which reflects the neighborhood. There were plenty of stairs in what appeared to be a large property, but there were also elevators in each building -- for those who don’t like to walk. My room, which had two queen beds, was conveniently located in the building across from the reception area. It was bright (if you turn on the lights or open your window) and spacious (for one or two individuals). Also included was a refrigerator, coffee maker, microwave and safe box. Oh, there were also two complimentary bottles of water in the fridge. Cleanliness: My room was clean with everything working. The housekeepers did an adequate job maintaining the room during my brief stay there; they also restocked the supplies. The hotel grounds appeared immaculate as well with its lovely courtyard and garden. Service: The staff in the front desk were overall courteous and helpful. I arrived in the morning--too early to check in, but they agreed to hold my luggage until I returned. When I asked about car parking, one of the staff members suggested that I park free across the street if I wanted to avoid the hotel’s parking charge. A staff member even printed out directions for me to drive to the zoo when I mentioned I was going there. Pool: I didn’t use the hotel’s pool. However, it appeared uncrowded when I got there with two guests apparently enjoying it. I was tempted to use the Jacuzzi as well, seeing that no one was there. From where my room was located, however, I felt like I was walking through a maze just to get through the pool area. Value: The room rate I paid ($169 per night) during the peak summer season was slightly less or comparable to other hotels in Old Town. Other fees include parking ($12 night) and a “resort fee” ($5 per day). The property itself is located in a quiet neighborhood, but conveniently located about a block from all the sites, shops and restaurants of historic Old Town. If you’re looking for a charming slice of San Diego, this is the place to stay! Other tips: Take the Old Town Trolley Tour for a guided hop on-off tour of the city. Dine at Café Coyote – happy hour is the best in Old Town. And visit the historic Whaley House - the "most haunted" in America.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel, but lots of stairs”
Reviews.Author: Hedgehog075
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January 2007 for a board of directors meeting. The hotel has a great deal of charm, and the grounds are lovely. I enjoyed the food in the restaurant, although the service was a little slow. Room service was quick and food was delivered at the correct temperatures exactly as I requested. The rooms were a little worn around the edges and on the dark side, but very clean and neat. I had no difficulties with the service. Truly the only real problem I had was that the layout was very confusing and required climbing lots of stairs. There were times when I thought I was trapped in a game of shoots and ladders.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has problems”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLosthiker
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights there and it was just ok for us. When we arrived to our room they didn't put enough towels for us. The jacuzzi by the pool was so hot you couldn't use it. I told them about it and nothing was done to fix the problem. The restaurant Acapulco on the premises was horrible. It was the worst mexican food we have eaten, Taco Bell is much better tasting. If you want very good mexican food go into Old Town and you will have many good choices of places to dine at. Upon checking out they charged me a $5.00 per night resort fee ??? I asked them what's this extra charge was and they said it was for the bottled water in the mini fridge and the newspaper they delivered to my room every morning. Well first of all we did not ask for the water and second I did not get a morning paper at all and come to think of it I did not see one paper at any room door step for the 3 days we were there. Last but least I had a maid trying so hard to get in our room to clean it when I shouted through the door that I just woke up and was buck naked and she was still trying to unlock the door. I told her it's only 9:30 am and come back later and she was still trying to get in. Well she finally went away after I opened the door with my boxers on and hung the DO NOT DISTURB sign on. If she only knew ENGLISH this wouldn't have happened.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: luckiest1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a one night stay. The grounds really are special and the room was just great. The views from the many, many vantage points are awesome and the pool area was perfect for just chilling out. The location is wonderful, we easily walked to the Old Town restaurants and historic sights and if you have a car, you can be to Sea World, the Zoo etc in absolutely no time. We will deffinately return to this pretty hotel next time we stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda keeps me coming back”
Reviews.Author: MiguelPHX
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hacienda Hotel in Old Town every month when I am in San Diego on business. I have always foudn the staff to be very accommodating and the property to be clean and neat. Over the years I have stayed in all of the buildings on the property and have seen constant cleaning, rennovations and improvements taking place to maintain the property. The Hacienda is more like a small village than a big box hotel. A series of buidings terrace up the hill with plazas and courtyards which allow guests in the 199 guest rooms to feel as if they have some air to breathe. All rooms are suites. The 700 building has efficiency kitchens. Decor is pleasant and in a Mexican style which is attractive and practical. Because the hotel is terraced up the hill, people with special needs or who need special access need to make this known when booking a reservation so as to be placed in a room close to street level. Internet service is fair but can grind to a halt on a busy late afternoon when everyone in the hotel is using it at the same time. I was assured by one of the Sales Managers that they were aware of the problem and were working with the broadband provider to upgrade the service. The fact that I was able to talk with a Sales Manager in a hotel these days was a very nice touch, but I always find the staff at the Hacienda to be approachable and omnipresent, ready to assist guests. In all of my stays at the Hacienda, the housekeeping staff have always been excellent. They are honest, efficient and friendly. All of the room sin which I have stayed have been properly cleaned and appointed. All rooms now include a small guest safe for valuables, two bottles of water in the refrigerator, coffee maker, hair dryer, iron and ironing board, cable TV, Internet service (wired - wireless in the lobby and common areas), use of the hotel airport shuttle, coffee in the lobby each morning and a choice of USA Today or the San DIego Union newspapers stacked at the bell desk in the lobby. As a Best Western Hotel, the Hacienda introduced the Wednesday meet and greet wine and cheese mixer for BW Gold Crown Club members . If a guest is not a member he/she may sign up on the spot and enjoy the refreshments as well as the benefits of the program. As a seasoned traveler, I do not expect any hotel to be "just like home". I expect some differences. A busy hotel cannot be all things to all people, but this one tries to accommodate all guest requests with a smile when it is within the power of the staff to do so. I have stayed at fancier properties which were cold and sterile and felt more like office buildings. The Hacienda is a relaxed, friendly place and much of this is due to a staff working behind the scenes to create the pleasant illusion of a small village setting.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hacienda”
Reviews.Author: foobar1028
Reviews.Content: I also had some apprehensions about staying at this hotel due to some of the reviews. However, my family and I had a very positive experience. The hotel grounds were beautiful and well maintained. Our room was very nice with a beautiful view overlooking the whole city. The linens were nice and so were the carpets and furnishings. The staff was very polite and helpful. The only negative thing I have to say is that we had to take three different elevators to get to our room. We were on the top floor in kind of a remote building (buildings are spread out) and it did take some time to get up there. But all in all it was worth it because we had a wonderful view from our room. I would definitely recommend this hotel. July 2007

Reviews.Title: “Don't spend the $ for this place!”
Reviews.Author: nradovsky
Reviews.Content: Please don't stay at this place! We just came back from a short family trip to San Diego with my husband and 2 kids. The hotel is VERY old, dirty, and shaby. It has NO sound proof at all.Our room was dark, tiny and everything starting with linnens was old and not fresh. My kids couldn't fall asleep because somebody was laughing in the room next to ours and then somebody else was simply walking on the upper floor but you can hear every word, every sound. You can hear a toilet flash in the room next to yours! Also, beware that it's close to the railroad, so you can hear the trains passing by during the night. Bad place with a poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: WirelessTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit better than most Best Westerns, but they do like the fact that they are in San Diego and near Old Town....For $150+ per night, you can get something much cleaner, convenient and not trying to nickle and dime you. The rooms are kind of dingy with old carpet and the bed spreads should have been replaced 2 years ago. The location to Old Town is nice and convenient, but there are many other newer places in Gaslight area that have easy access to great restaurants and shops. ALso, they charged $3 a night for a "resort fee" that they say is for the shuttle, 2 bottles of water, a newspaper, internet access, etc. I did use the shuttle (most hotels in this area are free), and I did use the internet (it was wired only in my room, unless I wanted to sit outside for wireless), I didn't get any bottled water (in fact the water main in Old Town broke this day, so no shower either) and the newspaper is one that is on a holder in the lobby for one person to read at a time. This kind of charge is cheesy, particulalry when you don't get the value for it.

Reviews.Title: “Not first choice, but ok stay”
Reviews.Author: gottogonow
Reviews.Content: We had some apprehension about staying here after reading some of the reviews over the past few months but we had a good experience. I had booked this hotel as a last resort after every hotel we wanted to stay in was booked over Valentines day and the day after. There was a huge medical convention and by the 14th there were no rooms available in all of San Diego luckily we made the reservation almost a year in advance. We asked for a room in building 6 and had a beautiful view of San Diego. The room furnishings were very dated in that building but a friend that stays there often says there are buildings that have been updated. The room was very dark and not great for reading or putting on makeup. The people at the front desk were very helpful and arranged for the shuttle to take us to the port to meet our cruise ship. We also heard the construction going on below us but it was not too bad where we were. One night we ordered room service and were underwhelmed. Not great, did not get what I ordered but it was edible. It was not worth the hassle to send it back. Overall the grounds were beautiful, it was a great location, service was fine and the price $150 for our room was ok (supply and demand!). In all honesty we would have booked the Marriott or the Omni if there had been rooms available, but on the bright side we saved money and had two good nights sleep, not luxurious but comfortable. We would recommend this hotel to someone that wants to stay in old town without spending an arm and a leg.

Reviews.Title: “Post-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: TripInsider
Reviews.Content: We had a great cruise, but arrived in San Diego to find AA had canceled all Chicago flights, so we rebooked for 3 days later. Of course, at that point, we were homeless in San Diego. Taking a hint from fellow cruisers, who had a pre-cruise stay here, we called. Lovely Monica confirmed our room, gave us a AAA rate, and dispatched the courtesy van to retrieve us from the cruise ship terminal. We felt so lucky. The luck continued. It was a short trip back to Hotel/motel.Van drivers told us lots to do. We arrived, bags promptly arrived. Our room was on the 6th level, we watched the cruise ship pull out of port on its weekly rounds of the Mexican coast. Room was large, dark mediterranean-style furniture, sleeping area set off by a half wall from couch. Wooden shutters on windows. Plenty of towels, bath products, lots of room for all the bags. Secure, efficient, clean property with very helpful staff. Pretty grounds are enclosed by security gates. Units of rooms are set into hillside. Lots and lots of steps, but elevators available. Enough palms to make setting feel tropical. Room service and restaurant on site. Saw pool, too cold to use this time. Great location. Downhill trek to Zocalos-very good, Coyote Cafe, fine for lunch or margaritas, Living Room Cafe for coffee, Cold Stone Creamery, and a super locally brewed rootbeer stand-try it! Historic old town was a good walk, flea market on Sat. afternoon, lots of sidewalk cafes... Next day van dropped us off at Midway Museum. We had a stellar day there, followed by dinner at the Fish Market, good for fresh catch. Obliging van took us back to the airport and off we went and here we are in snowy Chicago once again!

Reviews.Title: “Jarring juxtaposition, noisy nights”
Reviews.Author: robertl2
Reviews.Content: This hotel sprawls across a patchwork of parcels on a hillside overlooking San Diego Avenue that once was populated by single family homes and apartments of various sizes and styles. The grander of these toward the top of the hill remain overlooking the hotel. The more modest ones (one has the impression that the hotel bought up the parcels whose owners were willing to leave their neighbors to contend with the fallout) remain on isolated parcels as yet unsubsumed by the exterior boundaries of the hotel grounds, and have acquired a Tobacco Road stolidity that, defiantly interspersed with the faux Mexican architecture of the hotel, is evocative of God's Little Acre meets Puerto Vallarta, or vice versa. I had been here many years ago and for reasons I can't recall -- except that they were related to noise -- I'd decided I wouldn't return. But I did, last week, for a convention held by a group that apparently just couldn't do any better. It was a Third World experience without the charm or mystery. The rooms assigned the guests of the convention being held their were ROH. Mine was small and unhappily located near a practically overlying staircase which transmitted the sounds of people treading up and down during the small hours of the morning. Then a wrecking crew showed up at 7:30 in the morning to begin demolition of the staircase! On checking out I told the desk crew the room should never have been rented. They told me that if I had called the front desk they would have stopped the noise. As though they would have ordered an end to foot traffic on the staircase during the night and then given their wrecking crew the morning off till check-out time. They did allow $20.00 off the room rate. Still, this time there really won't be a next time.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: OldSchooler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a jewell. This property is spread out on a hillside overlooking the San Diego Bay area and has spectacular views of Point Loma and surrounding area. We arrived mid week late December and got to our room on the east side of buiding 6 and were dissapointed we weren't on the view side of the buiding. One quick call to the front desk and our rooms were changed to the View (west) side of the building. This property is spread out and has many stairs from the Old Town area up to building 6, 125 to be exact! We found the layout to be refreshing compared to the many hotels we have stayed at over the last 25 years or so. You can relax at many areas between the buildings. We were travelling with Senior citizens and when we needed to rent a wheelchair, the conceirge Seth, came through big time. He had a wheelchair delivered within 2 hrs. The proximity of this hotel to old town cannot be beat. We spent three nights and could not get enough of the atmosphere. Sure, the hotel rooms are a little outdated, but are clean and fairly spacious. The views off the balconys of the west side of building 6 are excellent!! Our family has previously stayed on the hotel circle and the Hacienda is our new favorite. Only downside I can advise of is the parking situation. 12 bucks to park and that doesn't guarantee you of a space. My advice is to be sure you park early and walk or taxi to what you have planned. I paid 12 bucks and had to park on the street on the last night of our stay ( FRIDAY) Made me mad but from what I hear and have seen is parking on the west coast is ranging from 9-35 dollars a night! Not worth my time to complain. Highly reccommend strolling the old town area after dark and sampling the local hospitality. Excellent food and drinks !!

Reviews.Title: “A great spot if you like mexican food and Margarita's, and really, who doesn't!”
Reviews.Author: Style72
Reviews.Content: A great chilled spot in Old Town, it has a much better vibe than downtown. I could literally throw a rock at a handful of very good restaurants. You don't need a car, with the trolley being a few blocks away, but if you have one, they don't charge you for parking. We walked in and out of the restaurant, didn't seem like what we were looking for. Pool was nice and having laundry onsite was a bonus as well. There are plenty of spots throughout the property to sit and have an evening in with a bottle of wine as well, although we didn't. Overall it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: macman2
Reviews.Content: Sitting on 5 acres of land over Old Town, San Diego this hotel is a short walk into town and very convenient. The hotel sits on several layers on a hill and the rooms are large, with heavy tile floors, microwave, refrigerator, TV, etc. We found the rooms were clean. One disappointment was that wireless internet was only in certain designated outdoor areas and lobby which meant that you had to sit outside to get on the internet.
